description.hltext_display: Quintana Roo Doing Holiday Giveaway
description.content: OOLTEWAH, TN (BRAIN)For the second year in a row, Quintana Roo (QR) will partner with Infinit Nutrition to give away a new 2011 CD0.1 frameset at midnight on January 1. The giveaway is part of a holiday promotion in which one lucky winner will be chosen and contacted by Infinit Nutrition CEO, Michael Folan. Peter Hurley, CEO of American Bicycle Groups QR, praises the promotion for its consumer focus. He said, Promotions like this are great to be a part of because they excite consumers and drive traffic to our dealers. It is a win-win situation for all involved. Additionally, the cross-marketing partnership with Infinit gets our products in front of an audience that may not necessarily be very familiar with QRs dealer network. Named for the low coefficient of drag in the wind tunnel, the CD0.1 uses QRs premier Shift Technology for aerodynamic advantage in triathlon and is priced at $2,600. The CD0.1 frameset includes the high modulus carbon frame, aero carbon fork, headset, and front and rear brakesets. At the completion of the contest, the winner will visit his nearest local QR dealer to choose the appropriate size, get a photo taken for the QR blog, and get a free bag of Infinit customized nutrition. To register for the 2011 QR frameset giveaway, click on above link.

event_or_fact.property: Promotions like this are great to be a part of because they excite consumers and drive traffic to our dealers

description.hltext_display: A haven for littlest homeless
description.content:
Children find stable, nurturing environment at one.TLC school
Siblings Robert Guerrero, 11, and Divina Guerrero, 8, work on art projects at the one.TLC school for homeless children in Stockton.Ariel Zambelich/Special to The Record
Record Staff Writer
STOCKTON - Divina Guerrero, 8, opened a plastic bin about the size of a shoe box.
"I got my Play-Doh, I got my maps," she said, pulling things out one at a time. "I got my chocolates, I got my crayons."
Divina's mother, Veronica Lopez, said the box has become her daughter's traveling bedroom.
Helping the homeless
Homeless students in San Joaquin County need basic hygiene items such as toothpaste as well as new socks, underwear, towels, sweatshirts, backpacks and clothing.
To donate directly to one.TLC, write to knight.mk@sbcglobal.net or P.O. Box 83, Woodbridge, CA 95258.
To contribute to homeless children educated throughout the county, write to the SJCOE Educational Foundation at P.O. Box 213030 Stockton, CA 95213; or contact Mark Yost at (209) 468-9079 or myost@sjcoe.net.
Other agencies that serve the homeless include:
• Stockton Shelter for the Homeless: (209) 939-9733 or stocktonshelter.com
• Gospel Center Rescue Mission, Stockton: (209) 466-2138 or gcrms.org
• St. Mary's Interfaith Community Services, Stockton: (209) 467-0703 or ­stmarysinterfaith.org
• McHenry House, Tracy: (209) 835-2328 or ­mchenryhousetracy.org
• Lodi House: (209) 334-6346 or lodihouse.org
• Hope Ministries, Manteca: (209) 824-0658
"I tell her, 'If it fits, you can keep it.' "
Three years ago, Lopez; her husband, David; and their two children were living at the Stockton Family Shelter, completing counseling for drug addiction and planning an escape.
Within five years, the couple had said, they wanted to earn enough money to buy land "in the country." They wanted to raise animals. They wanted a quiet life.
They made it out of the shelter and into employment. But the climb is slow, stability is fragile, and the family is homeless again, sharing a 25-foot trailer with David Lopez's sister, so small that Divina's brother, 11-year-old Robert, must stay with other relatives.
"We were doing real well until I quit my job for who knows what reason," Veronica Lopez said. A careless moment of rash frustration that she now regrets.
And then, her husband's wages were garnisheed - they believe by mistake - so for two days of work, he took home a little more than $3.
"That really threw us for a loop," Lopez said.
They lost their home, they sold their car, and one of the first phone calls Lopez made when everything was unraveling was to the one.TLC school for homeless children.
"I know that the school is very nurturing to my children at this time," she said. "It's embarrassing for them to be going into shelters. It's embarrassing for them to hear their parents screaming at each other about finances."
At TLC, she said, "everyone's going through something. It feels good that in our time of hardship, we're not being judged."
Founded about 20 years ago by California State University, Stanislaus, Professor Sara Garfield, TLC offers students schooling as well as clothing, supplies, counseling, and referrals to medical and dental care.
It is operated by Garfield, the San Joaquin County Office of Education and the Stockton Unified School District, and it works to create a stable environment for children who, because of homelessness, are academically and socially vulnerable.
At their former school, Veronica Lopez said, Robert was getting into fights, and Divina just couldn't concentrate - she couldn't even remember her phone number - as stress at home mounted.
"The child does take that to school with her the next morning," she said. "Where are we going to be living? Where's my dog going to go?"
Last week at TLC, on one of the last days before winter break, teacher Gail Jones gave the children Christmas ornaments to decorate as they waited for the school day to end.
When Lopez arrived, Divina ran up to her and handed her a card.
"Hi Mom," it said. "I love you. Happy Holidays Mom and Dad."
Lopez told her it was beautiful.
"Little stuff like this, for a kid to give us, it means a lot to her," she said.
Divina went home (they got a ride from another teacher) with two stickers on her sweatshirt, earned because she "cleaned someone else's mess," she said.
She cleared some space at a small table - "that's my area" - and opened her box.
"My mom's going to get us an apartment," she said. "But it's big."
Contact reporter Jennifer Torres at (209) 546-8252 or jtorres@recordnet.com. Visit her blog at recordnet.com/parentingblog.

description.hltext_display: Lorient e Montpellier abrem rodada do Francês com 0 a 0
description.content:
A 19ª rodada do Campeonato Francês começou nesta terça-feira com um jogo fraco tecnicamente, que acabou sem gols. Em casa, o Lorient recebeu o Montpellier e ficou no 0 a 0.
A partida se arrastou, com as duas equipes criando poucas chances de gol. Aos 28 minutos da segunda etapa, o Lorient ainda ficou com um jogador a mais, após a expulsão do defensor centro-africano Mapou Yanga Mbiwa.
No final, o resultado deixou o Lorient em 12º, com 25 pontos, enquanto o Montpellier está um pouco acima, com 27, na nona colocação da Ligue 1.
Confira todos os jogos da 19ª rodada do Campeonato Francês:
Terça-feira, 21/dez
Arles-Avignon x Nice
Brest x Olympique de Marseille
Caen x Rennes
Lille x Saint-Etienne
Lyon x Auxerre
Monaco x Sochaux
Nancy x Paris Saint-Germain
Valenciennes x Toulouse
Bordeaux x Lens
Clique aqui e confira a classificação e as próximas rodadas da competição.

description.hltext_display: Bike Rentals Reveal Top Shops
description.content: CHICAGO, IL (BRAIN)An analysis of bike rental reservations across the United States has revealed stand out bike shops and rental statistics for comparison. The data, compiled by nationwide bike rental network RentaBikeNow.com is the first national snapshot of bike rental reservations and establishes a benchmark as the countrys bike friendliness continues to grow, according to a press release. "Perhaps the question we get most often is: How much does the average rental bike cost?" said George Gill, company president and founder. The answer, Gill reports is $35.63 per day, which hes quick to point out is an average of many bike types, rental shops and geographic locations. The number reflects daily rates for everything from $15 Florida beach cruisers to $85 high-end carbon road bikes in California, and everything in between.the average reservation is made 12.8 days in advance. While stats are interesting, the final evaluation goes beyond price and is heavily weighted by a renters specific experience at a bike shop. Were you an inconvenience at pick-up or were you treated like Lance Armstrong? To capture this critical element, RentaBikeNow.com sends satisfaction surveys via email to every renter after their bike has been returned. The growing pool of data paints a clearer picture of who the best bike shops are and what makes them great. The highest ranking shops share three common characteristics: customer focused attitude, flexibility and employee training. While attitude and training are fairly straight forward, flexibility centers around a shop's willingness to make minor adjustments and ensure the fit and bike condition are good. Accordingly, proper tire pressure goes a long way. Success in these areas has been a major driver in RentaBikeNow.coms first Rental Shop of the Year Awards. With over 300 participating shops in the RentaBikeNow.com network, the winners were recognized in four regions based on time zones. Bike supply and fair pricing were other factors used in selecting this years winners who are: PACIFIC: San Diego Bike Shop, San Diego, CA: Very decent bike and very good service . . . - Andre H. Its hard to miss the bright smile of owner Mo Karimi. With a convenient downtown location and a helpful attitude, a great rental experience is assured. MOUNTAIN: Bicycles Unlimited, St. George, UT Great staff! I arrived just at quitting time and they stayed over to set me up. - Thomas C. A truly professional bike shop with arguably some of the best riding in the country merely a stones throw away. CENTRAL: Bike Barn, Houston, TX The Bike Barn was great and they did a complete bike fitting for a simple rental. - Richard D. Six convenient locations with consistent customer service that customers consistently rave about. EAST: RoadFish Bike Shop, Hilton Head, SC They are super friendly and great to work with. - David I. If its hard to choose between a cycling or a beach vacation, get both! This shop offers a broad selection and great service that even includes delivery for a buck!

event_or_fact.property: Perhaps the question we get most often is: How much does the average rental bike cost?

description.hltext_display: Re-released report adds nothing to the case for Income Management
description.author: ChrisRedman
description.content:
Media Release | Spokesperson Rachel Siewert
in
Over a year after the release of a draft report caused a furore – when the Minister Jenny Macklin unjustifiably claimed it provided evidence to support continuing controversial measures in Aboriginal communities in Northern Territory – the release of the ‘final’ report adds nothing to the case for income management, according to the Greens.
“We are yet to see any strong and credible evidence that this expensive and punitive policy is delivering on any of its promised outcomes,” Senator Rachel Siewert, Greens spokesperson on Aboriginal Issues said today.
“The findings of this report on the reliability and validity of the evidence collected by FaHCSIA were damning and over twelve months sitting on a shelf have done nothing to change that,” said Senator Siewert.
The analysis of the FaHCSIA data by AIHW led them to conclude that ‘the overall evidence about the effectiveness of income management was not strong’, saying that the data ‘would sit towards the bottom of an evidence hierarchy’.
“Over a year later, with only a sentence changed here and there, the ‘final’ version of this report has finally been released on one of the last reporting days of the year, in what we might be led to conclude is an effort to avoid further controversy and embarrassment,” Senator Siewert said.
“The report does not provide any quantitative data on actual health outcomes and relies on a small client survey and a handful of focus group interviews in four selected communities.
“Opinion and hearsay is not a basis for decision making for a government that claims it is committed to ‘evidence-based’ policy.
“Over three years after the commencement of the intervention in the Northern Territory we are still waiting for the promised evidence. It looks like there may be more waiting to come,” Senator Siewert concluded.

event_or_fact.property: ?The findings of this report on the reliability and validity of the evidence collected by FaHCSIA were damning and over twelve months sitting on a shelf have done nothing to change that,?

description.hltext_display: Betsson AB: Betsson Opens up the Shop Again
description.content:
STOCKHOLM Regulatory News: Today at 15:00 Betsson (STO:BETSB.st - News) will open the shop at Götgatan 37 in Stockholm - for the third time.
Since the Supreme Administrative Court, in September, refused leave to appeal and refrained from making a reference for a preliminary ruling from the European Court of Justice, the shop has been kept closed. Now, Betsson has decided to open the shop again but this time Betsson has been enforced to comply with the Gaming Board’s injunction from 2008 which means that none of Betsson’s symbols or logos will be available in the shop.
After rulings in September made by the European Court of Justice, Betsson believes there is a support for an opening of the shop.
“Since it is legal to offer gaming services to Betsson's customers, we will continue fighting for the Swedish consumer’s right to a free choice of games which should be given “said Pontus Lindwall, CEO Betsson.
BETSSON AB’S OPERATIONS INVOLVE INVESTING IN AND MANAGING COMPANIES WHICH PROVIDE ONLINE GAMING SERVICES TO END-CUSTOMERS. BETSSON AB OWNS BETSSON MALTA WHICH OPERATES GAMES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS AND TOWARDS END CUSTOMERS VIA WWW.BETSSON.COM, WWW.CASINOEURO.COM AND WWW.CHERRYCASINO.COM. BETSSON MALTA OFFERS POKER, CASINO, CARD GAMES, LOTTERY, BINGO AND GAMES. CUSTOMERS ARE PRIMARILY FROM THE NORDIC REGION AND THE REST OF EUROPE. BETSSON AB IS LISTED ON OMX NASDAQ NORDIC MID CAP LIST, (BETS).
This information was brought to you by Cision http://www.cisionwire.com

event_or_fact.property: ?Since it is legal to offer gaming services to Betsson's customers, we will continue fighting for the Swedish consumer?s right to a free choice of games which should be given ?

description.hltext_display: Allen Sports Bucks Bulky Product Trend
description.content: VERO BEACH, FL (BRAIN)Ask Alex Allen how his rack business has fared in light of a down economy and youll sense a bit of hesitation. He timidly admits his company has hung in there pretty well, but hes not one to boast, or let the competition in on the secrets of his success. We havent had a down year since 1993, said Allen, president of Allen Sports, a company his father started in 1965 out of his garage. Were chugging along and we continue to focus on what we do. Allen said his company, whose line extends from hitch to trunk and even parking racks, has made its name at the value end of the spectrum. There are rack makers that sell racks that retail at $200 and up. Thats not us, Allen said. We give dealers a product they can make a full margin on but thats positioned at the $40 to $50 opening price point. Our objective is to give a dealer that opening price point that keeps a customer in the store. And while he said the trend in racks recently has been toward bigger and bulkier product, hes taking a different tack. The newest trunk racks in his lineup, the MT1 and MT2, fold down and come packaged in a box smaller than a shoebox. Theyre targeted toward bike commuters with a super compact design0.8 cubic feetthat allows them to carry it in a backpack or messenger bagshould they need to hitch a ride on a rainy day. We saw a need for something thats really small, Allen said. It offers a lot of advantages in terms of freight and it gives dealers an opportunity to merchandise trunk racks in a much smaller space. The racks, which can carry one or two bikes, begin shipping in January from Allen Sports factory in China and are available through six U.S. distributors. The one-bike model will retail for $55 to $60; the two-bike model for $80. Allen said initial reaction to the first samples has been strong with core customers. As someone whos grown up in the bike rack segment, Ive seen it all and this ones different. It comes fully assembled and folds down into a tiny little package. Thats what makes this new, he said.

description.hltext_display: TFK's Price Receives President's Award
description.content: SAN RAFAEL, CA (BRAIN)The President's Council on Fitness, Sports & Nutrition (PCFSN) has chosen Marilyn Price to receive a 2010 PCFSN Community Leadership Award. The award is given annually to individuals who improve the lives of individuals within their community by providing or enhancing opportunities to engage in sports, physical activities, fitness or nutrition-related programs, according to a press release. The longtime environmentalist and bicycle enthusiast Price uses her passions to improve the lives of at-risk children. In 1986, Price founded Trips for Kids (TFK), a nonprofit organization that opens the world of cycling to at-risk youth through mountain bike rides and Earn-a-Bike programs. Today the organization has more than 70 chapters located throughout the United States, Canada and Israel. "It is our pleasure to present this award to Marilyn Price," says Shellie Pfohl, executive director of the President's Council on Fitness, Sports & Nutrition. "Physical activity and good nutrition are important components of living a healthy lifestyle, and we are pleased to recognize individuals like Marilyn Price who are committed to making a difference and positively influencing the health of their communities." "Trips for Kids is overjoyed to be the recipient of this prestigious award," said Marilyn Price, founding director of TFK. "Recognition from the President's Council will significantly boost our visibility and encourage more people to sign up as Trips for Kids chapters." This year, the President's Council presented the Community Leadership Award to 28 individuals across the country for making sports, physical activity, fitness, and nutrition-related programs available in their communities.

description.hltext_display: . العثمان: أكبر مبلغ يُخصص لجامعة الملك سعود منذ تأسيسها قبل 54 عاما
description.content:
رفع مدير جامعة الملك سعود معالي الدكتور عبدالله بن عبدالرحمن العثمان الشكر والتقدير باسمه وباسم منسوبي ومنسوبات الجامعة لخادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبد الله بن عبد العزيز آل سعود ولنائبه الأمير سلطان بن عبد العزيز ولي العهد وللنائب الثاني الأمير نايف بن عبد العزيز حفظهم الله على ما خُصص للجامعة من الميزانية العامة للدولة هذا العام 1432/1433.
وقال معاليه في تصريح صحفي اليوم انه على الرغم من الأزمات الاقتصادية التي هزت العالم ظلت بلادنا بفضل الله ثم بحكمة القيادة الحكيمة بمأمن من ذلك فلم تتأثر بشيء بل وتواصلت فيها جهود البناء والإصلاح وإطلاق المشروعات الكبيرة والتوسع فيها عاماً بعد عام .
وأضاف قائلا تتجلى في كل ميزانية تعلنها الدولة مدى عناية خادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبدالله بن عبد العزيز يحفظه الله ببناء الدولة والإنسان حيث تركَّزت ميزانية هذا العام التي تُعد الأضخم في تاريخ المملكة على البعد الإنساني والبعد التنموي عبر التوسع الكمي والنوعي في أهم الخدمات التي يحتاجها المواطن كالتعليم والرعاية الصحية اللذان يُعدان محورين في سياسة الإصلاح التي انتهجتها حكومة البلاد منذ سنوات إضافة إلى تركيز الميزانية على إطلاق المشروعات التي تعزز استمرار النمو والتنمية وتتيح المزيد من الفرص الوظيفية للمواطنين .
ودلل معاليه على ذلك بتخصيص 256 ملياراً لمشروعات جديدة وتوسعات في مشروعات سابقة لتحقيق رفاه المواطن وتوفير حياة كريمة له في بيئة مثالية تتوفر فيها كافة الخدمات.
وأوضح الدكتور عبدالله العثمان إلى أن المتأمل في سجل الأرقام الواردة في إعلان الميزانية يبرز البعد المعرفي ممثلاً في قطاع التعليم بوصفه الأهم بين كافة القطاعات بدليل حجم المخصص له البالغ 137,600,000 ويمثل 24% من مجموع الميزانية وهي النسبة الأكبر بين كل القطاعات،مبينا أن هذه العناية تجسد وعي القيادة برسالة التعليم، وأنه الخيار الوحيد للنهضة بالوطن والمواطن لكون الاستثمار في الإنسان هو أكثر أشكال الاستثمار أهمية وربحية ويعد النجاح في بناء العقل البشري شرطاً لنجاح أي مشروع حضاري أو تنموي.
وزاد بقوله ورد ضمن المشروعات المعتمدة لهذا القطاع تهيئة المحاضن النموذجية لبناء العقل البشري بإنشاء آلاف المدارس الجديدة في قطاع التعليم العام وتزويدها بالأجهزة والمعامل اللازمة لنضج العملية التعليمية وفي قطاع التعليم العالي سيتواصل استكمال إنشاء المدن الجامعية ومستشفياتها ومساكن أعضاء هيئاتها التدريسية في عدد من المناطق كما سيستمر نشاط برنامج خادم الحرمين الشريفين للابتعاث الخارجي.
وأردف معالي مدير جامعة الملك سعود قائلا انه بالنظر إلى حجم المبالغ المخصصة للجامعات نجد أن جامعة الملك سعود قد حظيت بالميزانية الأكبر حيث خُصص لها مبلغ 7,843,363,000 وهو أكبر مبلغ يُخصص للجامعة منذ تأسيسها قبل أكثر من 54 عاماً مؤكدا أن ما خُصص للجامعة هو أمانة ومسؤولية تلزم ترجمتها بدقة إلى واقع مشاهد ينهض بالإنسان ويتحول بالمجتمع إلى مجتمع معرفي يحتضن ثقافة المعرفة ويؤمن بدورها في تأسيس السمات الجديدة للوطن الحديث.
وانتهى الدكتور عبدالله العثمان الى القول أن جامعة الملك سعود تقرأ الرسالتين بوضوح وتتعهد بالالتزام في مواصلة استراتيجياتها التطويرية الهادفة إلى أن تكون جامعة رائدة على مستوى العالم قادرة على صناعة تحولات في حركة التعليم
تبرزه في صورة جديدة وتجعله مؤثراً في سياقات النهضة بالوطن.
ودعا المولى عز وجل أن يحفظ خادم الحرمين الشريفين وأن يمد في عمره وأن يمتعه بالصحة والعافية وأن يكتب الحفظ والرعاية لولي عهده الأمين ولنائبه الثاني وأن يجعلهما في عافية وسلامة دائمة.

description.hltext_display: Anti-terror Alliance Over if U.S. Troops Raid Across Border, Pakistan Warns
description.content:
(NewsCore) - Pakistan warned the United States Tuesday that the counter-terrorism alliance between the two countries would be broken if Washington attempted to expand its ground war across the border from Afghanistan into Pakistani territory.
The stark warning came after the US military reportedly pressed for permission to open a second front against militants by using special forces in cross-border raids into Pakistan. One officer said: âWeâve never been as close as we are now to getting the go-ahead.â
American military officials told The New York Times that commanders had drawn up plans to attack Taliban and al Qaeda sanctuaries in Pakistan. They had concluded that Islamabad had no intention of dislodging the militants, who are concentrated in the lawless tribal area of North Waziristan.
The officials said they were pushing for the White House to adopt the plan as a means of allowing a troop drawdown to begin as scheduled next year.
Abdul Basit, the Pakistani Foreign Ministry spokesman, reacted angrily to the suggestion that Islamabad would allow such incursions, adding: âWe have drawn a red line and any move to cross it will have a serious consequence.â
Major-General Athar Abbas, Pakistanâs chief military spokesman, insisted: âThere is a clear understanding that the Pakistani and US-led coalition forces will operate on the respective sides of the border.â
A senior Afghan official told The (London) Times that the American cross-border plans were real, although he suggested that they were intended more to exert pressure on the Pakistanis than to prepare for an imminent incursion. âIt is true but mainly symbolically and mere warning,â the official said.
The New York Times report was denied Tuesday by NATOâs deputy chief of communications in Afghanistan, US Rear Admiral Gregory Smith, who said that there was âabsolutely no truthâ in it.
Signing off on special forces operations into Pakistan would effectively authorize the opening of a second front in the Afghan war, a high-risk strategy about which the White House remains highly skeptical.
Vice-President Joe Biden has previously advocated stepping up a campaign in Pakistan that could include special forces raids but did so as an alternative to the current troop surge in Afghanistan rather than as an added extra. White House officials fear that the political backlash from expanding the ground war into Pakistan would far outweigh any military or intelligence benefits.
Pressure is mounting on the Obama administration over how to ensure that the promised troop reduction in Afghanistan can begin on schedule next summer with increasing concerns being voiced about Pakistanâs failure to tackle the source of the conflict -- the presence of Taliban sanctuaries on its soil.

event_or_fact.property: there was absolutely no truth in it.

description.hltext_display: مدير جامعة الملك سعود: ما خصص للجامعة يعد الأكبر في تاريخها
description.content:
رفع مدير جامعة الملك سعود الدكتور عبدالله بن عبدالرحمن العثمان الشكر والتقدير باسمه وباسم منسوبي ومنسوبات الجامعة لخادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبدالله بن عبدالعزيز آل سعود ولنائبه الأمير سلطان بن عبدالعزيز ولي العهد وللنائب الثاني الأمير نايف بن عبدالعزيز حفظهم الله على ما خُصص للجامعة من الميزانية العامة للدولة هذا العام 1432/1433.
وقال العثمان: على الرغم من الأزمات الاقتصادية التي هزت العالم ظلت بلادنا بفضل الله ثم بحكمة القيادة الحكيمة بمأمن من ذلك فلم تتأثر بشيء بل وتواصلت فيها جهود البناء والإصلاح وإطلاق المشروعات الكبيرة والتوسع فيها عاماً بعد عام.
وأضاف قائلا تتجلى في كل ميزانية تعلنها الدولة مدى عناية خادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبدالله بن عبدالعزيز يحفظه الله ببناء الدولة والإنسان حيث تركَّزت ميزانية هذا العام التي تُعد الأضخم في تاريخ المملكة على البعد الإنساني والبعد التنموي عبر التوسع الكمي والنوعي في أهم الخدمات التي يحتاجها المواطن كالتعليم والرعاية الصحية اللذان يُعدان محورين في سياسة الإصلاح التي انتهجتها حكومة البلاد منذ سنوات إضافة إلى تركيز الميزانية على إطلاق المشروعات التي تعزز استمرار النمو والتنمية وتتيح المزيد من الفرص الوظيفية للمواطنين.
ودلل على ذلك بتخصيص 256 ملياراً لمشروعات جديدة وتوسعات في مشروعات سابقة لتحقيق رفاه المواطن وتوفير حياة كريمة له في بيئة مثالية تتوفر فيها كافة الخدمات.
وأوضح الدكتور عبدالله العثمان أن المتأمل في سجل الأرقام الواردة في إعلان الميزانية يبرز البعد المعرفي ممثلاً في قطاع التعليم بوصفه الأهم بين كافة القطاعات بدليل حجم المخصص له البالغ 137,600,000 ويمثل 24% من مجموع الميزانية وهي النسبة الأكبر بين كل القطاعات، مبينا أن هذه العناية تجسد وعي القيادة برسالة التعليم، وأنه الخيار الوحيد للنهضة بالوطن والمواطن لكون الاستثمار في الإنسان هو أكثر أشكال الاستثمار أهمية وربحية ويعد النجاح في بناء العقل البشري شرطاً لنجاح أي مشروع حضاري أو تنموي.
وزاد بقوله ورد ضمن المشروعات المعتمدة لهذا القطاع تهيئة المحاضن النموذجية لبناء العقل البشري بإنشاء آلاف المدارس الجديدة في قطاع التعليم العام وتزويدها بالأجهزة والمعامل اللازمة لنضج العملية التعليمية وفي قطاع التعليم العالي سيتواصل استكمال إنشاء المدن الجامعية ومستشفياتها ومساكن أعضاء هيئاتها التدريسية في عدد من المناطق، كما سيستمر نشاط برنامج خادم الحرمين الشريفين للابتعاث الخارجي.
وأردف مدير جامعة الملك سعود قائلا انه بالنظر إلى حجم المبالغ المخصصة للجامعات نجد أن جامعة الملك سعود قد حظيت بالميزانية الأكبر حيث خُصص لها مبلغ 7,843,363,000 وهو أكبر مبلغ يُخصص للجامعة منذ تأسيسها قبل أكثر من 54 عاماً مؤكدا أن ما خُصص للجامعة هو أمانة ومسؤولية تلزم ترجمتها بدقة إلى واقع مشاهد ينهض بالإنسان ويتحول بالمجتمع إلى مجتمع معرفي يحتضن ثقافة المعرفة ويؤمن بدورها في تأسيس السمات الجديدة للوطن الحديث.
وانتهى الدكتور عبدالله العثمان الى القول إن جامعة الملك سعود تقرأ الرسالتين بوضوح وتتعهد بالالتزام في مواصلة استراتيجياتها التطويرية الهادفة إلى أن تكون جامعة رائدة على مستوى العالم قادرة على صناعة تحولات في حركة التعليم تبرزه في صورة جديدة وتجعله مؤثراً في سياقات النهضة بالوطن.
ودعا المولى عز وجل أن يحفظ خادم الحرمين الشريفين وأن يمد في عمره وأن يمتعه بالصحة والعافية وأن يكتب الحفظ والرعاية لولي عهده الأمين ولنائبه الثاني وأن يجعلهما في عافية وسلامة دائمة.

description.hltext_display: Rama Yade en voie d'être nommée ambassadrice à l'Unesco
description.content:
L'ex-secrétaire d'Etat Rama Yade devrait être nommée mercredi en Conseil des ministres ambassadrice, déléguée permanente de la France auprès de l'Unesco en remplacement de Catherine Colonna, a-t-on appris de source proche du dossier, confirmant une information de RTL. Figurant parmi les personnalités les plus populaires en France, Rama Yade, 34 ans, devrait être nommée ambassadrice auprès de l'Organisation des Nations unies pour l'éducation, la science et la culture, dont le siège est à Paris.
Ex porte-parole de l'Elysée sous Jacques Chirac, ex-ministre de Affaires européennes, Catherine Colonna occupait cette fonction depuis 2008.
Rama Yade a été secrétaire d'Etat aux droits de l'Homme (2007-2009) puis secrétaire d'Etat aux Sports (2009-2010). Après avoir fait ses premières armes à l'UMP, poussée par Nicolas Sarkozy, elle a rejoint récemment Jean-Louis Borloo au parti radical.
De la visite de Kadhafi à sa critique -tardive- du discours de Dakar, en passant par ses caprices électoraux, la jeune femme, qui a eu 34 ans en décembre, a incarné au gouvernement l'anti-conformisme plus que la "diversité", aux Droits de l'homme puis aux Sports.
Née à Dakar d'un couple d'enseignants proche de Senghor, elle est arrivée en France à onze ans. Elle est diplômée de Sciences po, administratrice du Sénat, avant d'apparaître pour la première fois sous les feux des projecteurs le jour de l'investiture de Nicolas Sarkozy comme candidat UMP à l'élection présidentielle en janvier 2007.
Battue aux municipales à Colombes en 2008, Rama Yade a tenu tête à deux reprises au chef de l'Etat et à l'UMP en refusant de se présenter aux Européennes en 2009, puis en choisissant de se présenter dans les Hauts-de-Seine et non dans le Val-d'Oise aux régionales de 2010.

description.hltext_display: Watch for Estee Lauder to Potentially Pullback after Gaining 1.29% Yesterday (EL)
description.content:
Estee Lauder (NYSE:EL) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $79.29 to a high of $80.16. Yesterday, the shares gained 1.29%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $79.50 on volume of 908,000 shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Estee Lauder are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $72.39 and above their 200-day MA of $64.16. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Estee Lauder in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 21, 2010 at $60.52. The stock has risen 30.7% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $79.50 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Personal & Cleaning Products industry.
Keywords: Estee Lauder trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: Venezuela censors the net
description.author: Nick Farrell
description.content:
Venezuela's President Hugo Chavez has decided that the best way to control his flagging popularity is to censor the world wide wibble.
Under a new law, passed by the Venezuelan parliament, any internet content that "promotes social unrest, challenges authority or condones crime will be banned.
According to AFP , Chavez's ruling party pushed the law through in less than a week and it expands 2004 restrictions on content in radio, television and print media.
The new law makes webpage managers "responsible for the information and content" published on their websites."
The law is meant to crack down on media content that "makes an apology of crime," "promotes unrest in the population" or "challenges legally established authorities."
Of course a remit like that is so wide that you could land a 747 on it, sideways and so it is basically a tool to shut down any site that Chavez does not like and to put the fear of God into website owners.
Webpage managers must now "establish mechanisms to restrict, without delay, the diffusion of messages... that are included in the ban."
If they get into trouble they could lose up to "10 percent of the previous year's gross income," in addition to "72 hours of continuous suspension of services."
Last week, Venezuela's parliament gave President Chavez decree powers for 18 months, effectively turning South America's biggest oil producer into a dictatorship. After 12 years in power and with flagging support, it seems that he wants to entrench his self-styled "revolution" which has done little to help his poor, rural support base. We guess his supporters don't use the net much.

description.hltext_display: ندوة انتقاء المواهب ينظمها اتحاد التربية البدنية
description.content:
ينظم الاتحاد السعودي للتربية البدنية والرياضة ندوة انتقاء المواهب مستقبل الرياضة السعودية” بمشاركة عدد من المتخصصين يوم الثلاثاء 22/1/1432ه.
وقال رئيس مجلس ادارة الاتحاد الدكتور هاشم بن بكر حريري: “الهدف من هذه الندوة السعي الى تأكيد اهمية الاكتشاف المبكر للموهوبين في مختلف الأنشطة الرياضية وهم الناشؤون من ذوي الاستعدادات العالية، التي تمكنهم من الوصول إلى المستويات العالية من الأداء في مجال نشاطهم والتنبؤ بما ستؤول إليه هذه الاستعدادات في المستقبل، وتوجيه الراغبين في ممارسة الأنشطة الرياضية إلي المجالات المناسبة لميولهم واتجاهاتهم واستعداداتهم، وتحديد الصفات النموذجية (البدنية، النفسية المهارية، الخططية) التي تتطلبها الأنشطة الرياضية المختلفة، أي: تحديد المتطلبات الدقيقة التي يجب توافرها في الملاعب حتى يحقق التفوق في نوع معين من النشاط الرياضي، وترسيخ الوقت والجهد والتكاليف في تعليم وتدريب من يتوقع لهم تحقيق مستويات أداء عالية في المستقبل، وتوجيه عمليات التدريب لتنمية وتطوير الصفات والخصائص البدنية والنفسية للاعب، في ضوء ما ينبغي تحقيقه، وتحسين عمليات الانتقاء من حيث الفاعلية والتنظيم”.
واشار الى ان الندوة تضم عدداً من الجلسات الأولى بعنوان: (الموهبة الرياضية وكيفية انتقائها “المفاهيم – الأهداف – أساليب الانتقاء” ويتحدث خلالها المشرف على مختبر فسيولوجيا الجهد البدني في جامعة الملك سعود الدكتور هزاع بن محمد الهزاع، ويدير الجلسة وكيل كلية التربية البدنية والرياضة للشؤون الأكاديمية بجامعة الملك سعود الدكتور علي بن محمد جباري.
وعنوان الجلسة الثانية: (توجهات وزارة التربية والتعليم نحو المواهب الرياضية “التنظيم والدعم، والبرامج ودور معلم التربية البدنية”) ويتحدث فيها مدير عام النشاط الرياضي ومدير النشاط المكلف بوزارة التربية والتعليم الدكتور سعد السند، ويدير الجلسة الدكتور مساعد بن ناصر العلياني.
وعنوان الجلسة الثالثة: (اهتمام الرئاسة العامة لرعاية الشباب والاتحادات الرياضية بالمواهب الرياضية “الاكتشاف والرعاية والتأهيل”) والمتحدث رئيس الاتحاد السعودي للتنس الدكتور عبدالرحمن بن سعد العنقري، ورئيس الاتحاد السعودي للجمباز الدكتور علي بن عبدالله الجفري، ويدير الجلسة رئيس قسم التربية البدنية وعلوم الحركة بجامعة الملك سعود الدكتور جمال بن صالح القروني.
وسيتم عقد الندوة في قاعة المحاضرات بمجمع الملك فيصل الاولمبي.

description.hltext_display: Instant Unsecured Personal Loans - Quick Asst Free Cash For Use
description.content: Are you looking for an alternative that would let your have risk free finance? Do you need to fulfill your personal wants with it? If yes then instant unsecured personal loans are perfect for you. In the case of this fiscal service, the borrower can get hold of quick asset free cash for use. Both renters as well as property owners can apply for this service.The process of asset check is not followed, and thus you would obtain risk free money. You would get instant unsecured personal loans without placing any of your assets such as car, house, stock papers and so on as a security against the credit that you want. The lender charges higher interest rate to lower the risk for him selfWith instant unsecured personal loans, the borrower can arrange an amount that falls in the range of £1000 to £25000 according to your settlement stability and monetary capacity. One has to repay the borrowed amount in comfortable time span of 1 to 10 years. By putting into use the borrowed credit, you can do number of things. You can settle your debts, can pay the monthly house rental, can pay the installments of the credit card, can pay the household and utility bills and so on.A no obligation and free of cost online application form would be given on the websites of the money lenders. Make use of it and apply. Fill it with your genuine personal details. As the process of verification is over, the borrower gets an approval. The approved credit would come into your bank account within the least possible duration. There is no faxing hassle here. Apart from this, all kinds of adverse credit scores such as IVA, bankruptcy, CCJs, foreclosures, insolvency, arrears and so on would not be paid much heed to.

description.hltext_display: تطوير مهارات الاتصال لموظفي جامعة الملك سعود الأحد القادم
description.content:
تنظم عمادة تطوير المهارات بجامعة الملك سعود دورة (مهارات الاتصال للموظفين) يومي الأحد والاثنين القادمين 21-22/1/1432ه من الساعة العاشرة صباحاً حتى الثانية والنصف ظهرا بمبنى 26 الدور الخامس، لجميع موظفي الادارات والاقسام بمختلف كليات وادارات الجامعة.
واوضح عميد تطوير المهارات الدكتور محمد بن احمد السديري ان المتدرب سيتعرف على مفهوم الاتصال وأشكاله وأهدافه وتحديد عناصر عمليات الاتصال وكذلك معرفة معوقات الاتصال الفعال وإجادة بعض مهارات الاتصال، واستعراض أهم مهارات الاتصال الإداري.
واضاف بان هذه الدورة تأتي تلبيةً لاحتياج الموظفين بأقسام ووحدات جامعة الملك سعود إلى تنمية مهارات الاتصال الفعال في ممارساتهم الشخصية والإدارية من خلال فهم طبيعة الآخر وتبني وسائل التواصل الفاعلة.
واردف بانه يمكن التعرف على مزيد من المعلومات عن مختلف الدورات التي تنظمها العمادة وللتسجيل بهذه الدورات والبرامج، فيتم من خلال زيارة موقع عمادة تطوير المهارات http://dsd.ksu.edu.sa

description.hltext_display: Radar scam case ruling draws mixed reaction
description.content:
Picketers outside the London Court yesterday.
There has been mixed reaction – but mainly negative – to yesterday’s decision by a British court to fine a British defence contractor linked to the sale of a radar system to Tanzania.
A number of senior public officials were implicated in the controversial deal which has been at the centre of raging public debate for years now.
Most people interviewed by this paper yesterday expressed dismay, anger and frustration over the ruling, saying what Tanzanians had expected was to see people associated with the shady deal appearing before courts of law to answer charges against them.
Some said the ruling was clear proof of double standards by foreign international organisations which keep lecturing African countries on the virtues of good governance, transparency and accountability for African nations while acting to the contrary. However, a few voices were of the view that the UK court had played its part and it was upon those aggrieved by the ruling to seek justice elsewhere.
In the ruling, BAE Systems has been fined £500,000 for failing to keep proper records of payments it made to an adviser in Tanzania - in a radar purchase scandal that involved high-profile government figures in Tanzania’s third-phase (Benjamin Mkapa) government.
The UK defence contracting company paid £7.7m to two firms controlled by businessman Shailesh Vithlani ahead of winning a £28m Tanzanian military radar contract.
The ruling by a judge at Southwark Crown Court came after BAE had already agreed a deal with the UK government’s Serious Fraud Office (SFO).
Under the agreement struck between the SFO and BAE, the company would deduct the fine from the £30m it had offered to the people of Tanzania to settle the case.
Presiding Judge David Bean said he was under pressure to keep the court fine to a minimum, elaborating: “The structure of this settlement agreement places moral pressure on the court to keep the fine to a minimum so that the reparation is kept at a maximum.”
He criticised another part of the deal which he said gave any member of BAE Systems group “blanket immunity for all offences committed in the past, whether disclosed or not”.
He said the agreement was loosely and hastily drafted, adding: “Today’s judgment concludes and draws a line under this historical matter. The company accepts the decision of the court and will abide by it,” BAE said in a statement.
Contacted for comment, fiery Simanjiro legislator Christopher ole Sendeka said it was sad that the ruling by the UK court “has fallen awfully short of exposing high-profile government personalities involved in the controversial radar deal”.
He said Tanzanians were dying to know the people involved in the deal and thereafter see “appropriate” legal measures being taken against them.
“Instead of exposing the persons involved, the court merely fined the UK army company. In my opinion, the ruling was aimed at safeguarding the status of the few untouchable people in the government and leadership circles,” said the MP.
He recommended that African leaders learn from the radar case ruling and refrain from entering into agreements with “corrupt and non-transparent” international companies.
He blamed foreign and international organisations for practising double standards, saying they preach transparency and accountability to African nations while at the same time supporting corrupt deals.
“We have seen some of these organisations championing corrupt dealings and readily shouldering the burden of paying fines in order to hide evils committed by high-ranking government personalities,” Sendeka pointed out.
All that Prevention and Combating of Corruption Bureau Director General Dr Edward Hoseah would say when contacted for comment yesterday was: “I am in a situation where I cannot talk with anybody, please.”
Former Attorney General Andrew Chenge, one of the people suspected to be behind the controversial radar purchase deal, said: “I am now in Bariadi (his Shinyanga Region constituency) discussing issues with my electorate.”
“I cannot say anything on the ruling for now because I have neither seen nor read it…I must understand the context of the ruling before making any comments,” he added, promising to give his stand after going through the ruling.
The probe’s conclusion leaves BAE free to focus on dealing with an age of austerity in defence spending at home and abroad, according to Reuters.
The fine follows an enquiry into a 28 million pound deal to sell radar systems to Tanzania for use at Dar es Salaam airport, the biggest and busiest in the country.
“The residue of the agreed 30 million pounds will be paid by BAE to the people of Tanzania by a mechanism yet to be agreed,” an SFO spokesman told Reuters.
The court had been expected to sentence BAE on Monday but Justice Bean said he could not sentence the company without hearing more evidence.
Bean wanted to know what payments of around 8 million pounds – made to companies controlled by Tanzanian businessman Shailesh Vithlani between January 2000 and December 2005 – were used for before deciding on the fine.
“The victims of this way of obtaining business, if I have correctly analysed it, are not the people of the UK, but the people of Tanzania,” said the judge in his sentencing notes.
“The airport at Dar es Salaam could no doubt have had a new radar system for a good deal less than $40million if $12million had not been paid to Vithlani,” he added.
The judge explained that BAE now had higher ethical standards than in the past after criticisms made by Lord Woolf, the former Lord Chief Justice, in a 2008 review of its business ethics. “In the decade since the conduct referred to in this settlement occurred, the company has systematically enhanced its compliance policies,” BAE said.
Justice Bean said BAE’s plea deal with the SFO had been hastily drafted and he could not “sentence (BAE) for an offence which the prosecution failed to charge”, such as false accounting or conspiracy to corrupt.

description.hltext_display: Cash loan today: Easy funds to disperse off temporary cash crisis
description.content:
If suppose you are employed with a fixed and regular income source, it does not necessarily mean that all your financial problems will be over in a moment. There are certain expenses, which are always unaccounted for and have a tendency to come up, at a time, when you are in the midst of a crisis. Naturally, it is not possible to avoid these expenses and it is you who will have to take measures, so as to overcome the same. For the same reason, you can certainly opt for the provision of cash loan today.
This financial option does offer you payday loans today, which then can be used to sort out any impending crisis. In fact, the loan amount sourced can be used to deal with expenses related to paying credit card dues, emergency medical bills, house hold expenses, car accidental repair and so forth. Moreover, the loan being released for a short term period do offer you the chance to attain the same, without involving any collateral. Apart from these, the no credit check approval of the funds makes it possible for the applicants with multiple credit default to attain the funds.
If you are employed with a minimum monthly income of £1000 and have access to a valid checking account, then you can certainly avail the services of this loan. Apart from these, you must be a resident of UK and that your age should be more than 18 years.
It is on meeting these key requirements that you will be considered eligible for the loan. Under the aegis of this loan, you are free to borrow any amount in the range of £100-£1500. The repayment tenure is short and generally spans over a period of 14- 30 days. Although the interest rate levied is marginally high, viable rates can be sourced by undertaking a detailed research. You can also compare the quotes, using the online mode, so as to get access to the best possible terms.
Ultimately, it is only with the assistance of cash loan today, that you get to avail quick and instant monetary relief.

7名中国主裁获FIFA国际级资格 张雷王迪入精英名单
description.content:
大江网・体育频道2010-12-22 13:45
新浪体育讯 北京时间12月22日，据《体坛周报》报道，日前，中国足协已经受到了关于国际足联(FIFA)国际级裁判申报的批复。中国共有16名男子裁判被批准为国际级裁判，其中7人为主裁判。
据悉，被中国足协批复的7名主裁判为别为：王哲(32岁)、马宁(29岁)、张雷(27岁)、范琦(39岁)、赵亮(37岁)和谭海(40岁)。
去年，国际足联也曾经批准数名中国籍裁判成为国际级裁判。此后，黄俊杰因反赌扫黑落网，孙葆洁则已经到了国际级裁判年龄的上限(45岁)。虽然万大雪和陶然成在资格上没有问题，但是由于两人在足球界中有些争议，因此足协计划将两人像裁判监督方面培养。
此次入选的7名国际级主裁判中，王迪和张雷还入选了国际足联的精英裁判名单，有资格代表中国吹罚国际比赛。两人也将是中国足协未来的重点培养对象。
女裁判中，4名国际女主裁和4名女助理裁判获得国际足联批准，四名主裁判分别是林世琴、秦亮、王佳和顾盈，其中林世琴有望进入“精英裁判名单”。

description.hltext_display: Murphy Oil Set to Possibly Pullback after Yesterday's Rally of 0.95% (MUR)
description.content:
Murphy Oil (NYSE:MUR) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $72.77 to a high of $73.62. Yesterday, the shares gained 0.95%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $73.10 on volume of 980,000 shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Murphy Oil are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $67.38 and above their 200-day MA of $58.71. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Murphy Oil in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on July 23, 2010 at $53.72. The stock has risen 35.5% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $73.10 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Major Integrated Oil & Gas industry.

description.hltext_display: Petition to release Asia Bibi started by Warren Throckmorton attracting Americans
description.content:
(PCP) An American Evangelist Warren Throckmorton joined campaign to release a week ago but his petition on www.change.org have attracted more than five hundred Americans who have signed petition subject to “Tell Pakistan Not to Execute Asia Noreen Bibi”
The www.asianews.it is also campaigning for release of Asia Bibi and have received more than 8,000 signatures while Spanish Christians have signed more than 60,000 appeals for Asia Bibi. There is signature campaign in Pakistan and United Kingdom also.
The petition started by Mr. Warren Throckmorton is also addressed to President Asif Zardari (President, Pakistan), Syed Mumtaz Alam Gillani (Minister of Human Rights, Pakistan), and Husain Haqqani (Pakistani Ambassador to the United States)
Mr. Warren Throckmorton says “Writing in 1954, psychologist Gordon Allport said, “The role of religion is paradoxical. It makes prejudice and it unmakes prejudice.” In no case is Allport’s observation better illustrated than in the tragic situation of Asia Noreen Bibi. On Monday, NPR’s Julie McCarthy chronicled the story of Bibi, a 45 year-old, Christian mother of five who is now in a Pakistani jail with a death sentence over her head. Her crime? She was convicted last month of blaspheming the prophet Muhammad, which under Pakistan’s draconian blasphemy laws, allowed the court to sentence her to death. Although no person has yet been executed under these laws, local Muslim extremists, including those representing the Taliban, have threatened violence if she is not executed. Bibi has been in prison for over a year, awaiting the resolution of her fate, after being arrested following a verbal altercation with Muslim co-workers. According to reports, the Muslim women refused to accept water from her, calling her “unclean” due to her faith. She reportedly defended herself and then later was detained by the women, who tried to convert her. When this failed, Bibi was arrested and held in isolation until recently when the sentence of death was handed down. Last week, Imam Maulana Yousuf Qureshi, who once gained international notoriety by calling for the murder of Danish cartoonists who drew caricatures of Muhammad, issued a $5800 reward for the murder of Bibi. Qureshi said that Muslim extremists will kill Bibi if she is freed. Asia Bibi’s case requires an international outcry from people of all religious views. The bullying and murder of minority religious adherents in Pakistan must stop. Call upon the Pakistani government to free Asia Bibi and to guarantee safety for her and her family”
Pakistan Christian Post appeals to every one to join signature campaign for release of Asia Bibi.
Find petition on this link: If link not active, please, copy/paste in your browser to view it:

Muslim extremists will kill Bibi if she is freed.

description.hltext_display: . العثمان: جامعة الملك سعود حظيت بأكبر ميزانية منذ تأسيسها قبل أكثر من (54) عاماً
description.content:
الجزيرة – سعود الشيباني :
رفع معالي الدكتور عبدالله بن عبدالرحمن العثمان مدير جامعة الملك سعود، الشكر والتقدير باسمه وباسم منسوبي ومنسوبات الجامعة لخادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبدالله بن عبدالعزيز -يحفظه الله- ولنائبه الأمير سلطان بن عبدالعزيز ولي العهد وللنائب الثاني الأمير نايف بن عبدالعزيز يحفظهما الله على ما خُصص لجامعة الملك سعود من الميزانية العامة للدولة هذا العام 1432-1433هـ. وفي هذه المناسبة قال معالي الدكتور العثمان: على الرغم من الأزمات الاقتصادية التي هزت العالم، ظلت بلادنا بفضل الله ثم بحكمة القيادة الرشيدة بمأمن من ذلك فلم تتأثر بشيء، بل وتواصلت فيها جهود البناء والإصلاح وإطلاق المشروعات الكبيرة والتوسع فيها عاماً بعد عام.
وتابع معالي الدكتور عبدالله العثمان: وتتجلى في كل ميزانية تعلنها الدولة مدى عناية خادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبدالله بن عبدالعزيز -يحفظه الله- ببناء الدولة والإنسان، حيث تركَّزت ميزانية هذا العام التي تُعد الأضخم في تاريخ البلاد على البعد الإنساني والبعد التنموي عبر التوسع الكمي والنوعي في أهم الخدمات التي يحتاجها المواطن كالتعليم والرعاية الصحية اللذين يُعدان محورين في سياسة الإصلاح التي انتهجتها حكومة البلاد منذ سنوات، هذا بالإضافة إلى تركيز الميزانية على إطلاق المشروعات التي تعزز استمرار النمو والتنمية، وتتيح المزيد من الفرص الوظيفية للمواطنين، وليس أدل على ذلك من تخصيص (256) ملياراً لمشروعات جديدة وتوسعات في مشروعات سابقة لتحقيق رفاه المواطن، وتوفير حياة كريمة له في بيئة مثالية تتوفر فيها كافة الخدمات.
ونبَّه معالي الدكتور عبدالله العثمان إلى نقطة لافتة في إعلان الميزانية قائلاً: بتأمل سجل الأرقام الواردة في إعلان الميزانية يبرز البعد المعرفي ممثلاً في قطاع التعليم بوصفه الأهم بين كافة القطاعات بدليل حجم المخصص له البالغ (137.600.000) الذي يمثل (24%) من مجموع الميزانية، وهي النسبة الأكبر بين كل القطاعات، ولا شك أن هذه العناية تجسد وعي القيادة برسالة التعليم، وأنه الخيار الوحيد للنهضة بالوطن والمواطن، لكون الاستثمار في الإنسان هو أكثر أشكال الاستثمار أهمية، بل وربحية أيضاً، حيث يعد النجاح في بناء العقل البشري شرطاً لنجاح أي مشروع حضاري أو تنموي، إذ إن العقل هو المحرك لأي مشروع، وما لم يكن مؤسساً تأسيساً معرفياً متيناً فإنه ربما يفشل أو يتعثر في دفع حركة الحضارة. ولذا ورد ضمن المشروعات المعتمدة لهذا القطاع تهيئة المحاضن النموذجية لبناء العقل البشري بإنشاء آلاف المدارس الجديدة في قطاع التعليم العام وتزويدها بالأجهزة والمعامل اللازمة لنضج العملية التعليمية، وفي قطاع التعليم العالي فسيتواصل استكمال إنشاء المدن الجامعية ومستشفياتها ومساكن أعضاء هيئاتها التدريسية في عدد من المناطق، كما سيستمر نشاط برنامج خادم الحرمين الشريفين للابتعاث الخارجي.
وأردف معالي الدكتور عبدالله العثمان حديثه في هذا السياق بالقول: وبالنظر إلى حجم المبالغ المخصصة للجامعات نجد أن جامعة الملك سعود قد حظيت بالميزانية الأكبر، حيث خُصص لها مبلغ (7,843,363,000) وهو أكبر مبلغ يُخصص للجامعة منذ تأسيسها قبل أكثر من (54) عاماً، وأن ما خُصص للجامعة هو أمانة ومسؤولية تلزم ترجمتها بدقة إلى واقع مشاهد ينهض بالإنسان، ويتحول بالمجتمع إلى مجتمع معرفي يحتضن ثقافة المعرفة ويؤمن بدورها في تأسيس السمات الجديدة للوطن الحديث. وجامعة الملك سعود تقرأ هاتين الرسالتين بوضوح، وتتعهد بالالتزام في مواصلة إستراتيجياتها التطويرية الهادفة إلى أن تكون جامعة رائدة على مستوى العالم، قادرة على صناعة تحولات في حركة التعليم تبرزه في صورة جديدة، وتجعله مؤثراً في سياقات النهضة بالوطن.
واختتم معالي الدكتور عبدالله العثمان تصريحه بدعاء المولى الكريم أن يحفظ خادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبدالله بن عبدالعزيز، وأن يمد في عمره، وأن يمتعه بالصحة والعافية، وأن يكتب الحفظ والرعاية لولي عهده الأمين ولنائبه الثاني، وأن يجعلهما في عافية وسلامة دائمة.

description.hltext_display: Credit unions busy helping community
description.content:
Courtesy photo Employees of Granite State CU, Guardian Angel CU, NH Federal CU, Service CU and NH Credit Union League assisted at the Make-A-Wish Foundation of NH Holiday Reunion Party this season.
PORTSMOUTH — The New Hampshire Credit Union League, which represents New Hampshire's 26 consumer-owned credit unions, is pleased to announce that credit unions throughout the Greater-Seacoast area are generously supporting local charities, along with U.S. Military Service members this holiday season.
Service Credit Union, Northeast Credit Union, NH Federal Credit Union, Granite State Credit Union, Holy Rosary Credit Union and Seacoast Credit Union have been active this holiday supporting needs ranging from winter clothing drives for children to providing gift cards for members of the U.S. military serving overseas.
"While credit unions in New Hampshire come in different sizes and serve different fields of membership, credit unions share a common commitment to improve the quality of life in NH. The NHCUL actively supports and encourages credit unions in their community outreach efforts," said Michael L'Ecuyer, NHCUL Chairman of the Board.
For more information, visit www.gocuorg.

description.hltext_display: ５０００本のろうそく Ｘマス盛り上げ ２３日か...
Vatican urges prudence in reading leaked embassy cables
description.content:
Papal News,Vatican News, Editorial,
Related Stories
Holy See Press Office director, Fr Federico Lombardi, has asked for careful evaluation and “great prudence” in the examination of confidential files leaked by WikiLeaks to media outlets. The content of sensitive internal US State Department cables concerning the Vatican, written by representatives from the US Embassy to the Holy See, was made public Dec 11.
In a statement that day, Fr Lombardi stressed that the reports “reflect the perceptions and opinions of the people who wrote them.” He emphasized that the cables “cannot be considered as expressions of the Holy See itself, nor as exact quotations of the words of its officials. Their reliability must, then, be evaluated carefully and with great prudence, bearing this circumstance in mind.” Only one of the Vatican-related cables had been released prior to Dec 10.
However, over the course of the day, a barrage of articles on additional cables surfaced. Five newspapers, the New York Times, Britain’s The Guardian, France’s Le Monde, Germany’s Der Spiegel and Spain’s El Pais, reported on documents concerning the Vatican. These five media outlets are thought to be in exclusive possession of the “Cablegate” briefs. They span the last decade uncovering the US Embassy’s perceptions of Vatican positions on a variety of themes.
In a file from February 2009 labelled “confidential,” Julieta Valls Noyes, the second-in-command at the US Embassy to the Holy See wrote down her vision of communications within the Vatican. The cable came shortly after Pope Benedict XVI lifted the excommunication of a bishop without knowing that he denied the extent of the Holocaust. Valls pointed to a “communication gap” that marked “the challenge of governing a hierarchical yet decentralized organization,” as well as “leadership weaknesses at the top, and an undervaluing of (and ignorance about) 21st century communications.”
She added that these problems have resulted in “muddled, reactive messaging that reduces the volume of the moral megaphone the Vatican uses to advance its objectives.” In a separate cable from just weeks earlier, Valls commented that the Pope “sometimes bewilders politicians and journalists by pursuing what he believes is in the best interest of the Church.”
She added that “Vatican outsiders lament decisions or policies that they perceive as being out-of-step with the new millennium, and call for the Church to be more modern and accommodating. “What these observers fail to recognize is the consistency of the Holy See’s decisions and behaviour on key issues like the reunification of the Church or the dignity of all human beings — and the value of that consistency. “Regardless of whether outsiders agree or disagree with the Holy See, it’s hard to dispute its moral influence, geographic reach, and ability to grab headlines,” she wrote.
“These qualities can make the Vatican a formidable partner for the US and other nations in the pursuit of common objectives.” In a cable from July 2001, the embassy spoke of the Vatican as a “supra-national power,” with limited territory but extensive influence in the world. The Vatican-related cables numbering over 800 form just a small part of the more than alleged 250,000 secret and confidential documents due for release by WikiLeaks.

description.hltext_display: AFC East: From frying pan to fire for Dolphins' Sparano
description.content: (Sports Network) - April showers bring May flowers. And playoff elimination yields coaching pontification. That's the environment in which Miami Dolphins head coach Tony Sparano finds himself as the season winds down for two now-meaningless games after the Dolphins were mathematically KO'd from playoff consideration by a 17-14 home loss to Buffalo on Sunday. Surprise champions of the AFC East two seasons ago and a formidable late-summer entity this year after acquiring prolific wide receiver Brandon Marshall, the Dolphins have instead floundered in key spots throughout while tumbling to third in the division behind 12-win New England and the 10-win New York Jets. The loss to the Bills puts Miami at 7-7 overall, just 1-6 at home and 6-1 on the road. And it puts Sparano and his staff on the hot seat heading into a potentially turbulent offseason. "It's easy to point blame, fellas," Sparano said at a Monday media gathering. "I get it. It comes with the territory. That's just the way it goes." Sparano provided a public endorsement of embattled offensive coordinator Dan Henning, just a day after the Dolphins scored less than 20 points for the eighth time in 14 games -- including three straight in December. Henning came out of retirement in 2008 to join Sparano's staff and was widely lauded for his use of then-starting quarterback Chad Pennington along with unveiling the Wildcat offensive package with running back Ronnie Brown. This season, he's been vilified in South Florida for the Dolphins' offensive inconsistency. Henning is widely expected to re-retire after the Jan. 2 finale against the Patriots, which will come after Miami hosts 4-10 Detroit this weekend. "I think that Dan Henning for Tony Sparano has been tremendous, and I think that the guy has done a wonderful job here in my time here," Sparano said. "I look at the entire body of work. "He's the same guy that we were all talking about, [saying] 'Man, oh man, he finds ways to use the personnel to the best of their ability.' That was you people saying that. Not me. I would tell you that for Tony Sparano, Dan Henning has been tremendous." Sparano's own job security has been the stuff of whispers as well, particularly after Miami was reportedly among the destinations on Bill Cowher's wish list should the former Pittsburgh coach come back to the NFL sidelines next season. The return of ESPN analyst Jon Gruden has also been discussed in the Sunshine State, largely because of his Super Bowl success with Tampa Bay in 2002. Cowher's career record is 149-90-1 in the regular season and 12-9 in the playoffs, and his Steelers won a Super Bowl title after the 2005 season. Gruden is 95-81 in regular-season play and 5-4 in the postseason. Sparano's regular-season and postseason records are 25-21 and 0-1, respectively. "I just need to get my team ready to play this week," Sparano said in reference to his status. "That's all I need to do. That's my concern. Get the team ready to play the Detroit Lions this week. Everything else is out of my control. Let somebody else deal with it." BILLS: Don't look now...but here come the Buffalo Bills. Okay, sure, head coach Chan Gailey & Co. have long been eliminated from playoff contention after an ugly 0-8 start, but four wins in six games since has got the lone NFL team based in New York state harkening back to its home city's old 1980's marketing tagline -- "Talkin' Proud." "It's always good to win a game, and I tell you what, what is hard for me to figure out is how we can win these games when we started out with no players," owner Ralph C. Wilson said on Sunday after an impromptu visit to the locker room following a 17-14 defeat of the Miami Dolphins at Sun Life Stadium. "Our drafts in the last 10 years have been terrible. So I mean, these guys, before each play you read the scorecard to see who's in there. That's what amazes me. We pick up a guy in the middle of the week and he starts on Sunday." The Bills ended the season-starting losing skid with a 14-12 win over visiting Detroit on Nov. 14 and made it two straight with a road victory at Cincinnati seven days later. Consecutive losses to Pittsburgh and Minnesota followed to drop the team's record to 2-10, but good feeling has since returned with a 13-6 win over Cleveland and the successful trip to South Florida. "Chan has done a great job and the players have played hard," Wilson said. "It's amazing. This team amazes me. I guess it's because they play hard. A lot of [the players] were overlooked in the draft. A lot of them were cut by other teams that didn't have enough patience with them. All of those things play into it. So we should be much, much better next year." On Sunday, Buffalo was outgained by 44 yards and had seven fewer first downs than the Dolphins, but nonetheless scored the game's first 10 points and never trailed, limiting Miami to just one scoring drive in each half. On the other side, Dolphins linebacker and NFL sack leader Cameron Wake was held to just one quarterback pressure and two tackles, allowing Bills quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick to complete 16-of-26 passes for 223 yards and touchdowns to wide receivers David Nelson and Steve Johnson. "We had a tough time running the ball [Sunday], but up front the protection was good," Fitzpatrick said. "[The linemen] did a great job all day keeping me clean. You can't say enough about those guys up front just in terms of the patchwork and guys getting plugged into spots." JETS: One day after the New York Jets' highest-quality win of the season's second half, the team held its collective breath on the results of an MRI on the right shoulder of quarterback Mark Sanchez. But the University of Southern California product, who completed 19-of-29 passes for 170 yards, ran for a touchdown and most importantly, didn't turn the ball over in a 22-17 road defeat of the Pittsburgh Steelers, was pronounced fit to start this weekend's game against the Chicago Bears at Soldier Field. "Precautionary," Jets head coach Rex Ryan said of the MRI. "Anytime it's your quarterback, you're going to make sure he's okay. Like I said, the MRI was a positive thing for us." According to Ryan, Sanchez was hurt on New York's second drive of Sunday's game. On third-and-18 from the Pittsburgh 34-yard line, he scrambled and was sacked by ex-Jets linebacker James Farrior. The injury is being called a sore throwing shoulder and Ryan said Sanchez may be slightly limited in this week's practices in preparation for the Bears. The young signal-caller's backup is 40-year-old Mark Brunell, who threw exactly 30 passes last season while backing up Drew Brees in New Orleans. "[Sanchez's] arm was in an awkward position," Ryan said of the injury. "It never affected him. He played the whole game. He played great. He really did. As somebody said, 'Maybe this should happen to you in all these games', because he played great." Sanchez scored the Jets' first offensive touchdown since Nov. 25 on a fourth- and-goal play-action bootleg in the third quarter. He was not sacked against the Steelers after being hit four times in a Dec. 6 loss to the New England Patriots and sacked six times by the Miami Dolphins in Week 14. Offensive tackle Damien Woody was lost for the season with a knee injury in the 10-6 loss to Miami, but Pittsburgh's duo of James Harrison and LaMarr Woodley was kept away from Sanchez largely through the efforts of Wayne Hunter, who took over Woody's starting spot on the right side. "Wayne stepped in, did a great job," said Ryan. Reserve lineman Rob Turner was used in many packages as a tight end as well, a strategy that may be repeated against Chicago's Julius Peppers and Israel Idonije. The win largely solidified New York's position as a playoff team, maintaining its two-game lead over San Diego and Jacksonville in the chase for the AFC's final Wild Card position. The Jets can guarantee a spot with a win in either of their final two games, either at Chicago this week or at home with Buffalo on Jan. 2. If the postseason began today, the Jets would earn the conference's No. 6 seed and visit Kansas City in the opening round of the AFC Playoffs on the weekend of Jan. 8-9. PATRIOTS: Okay, so perhaps arguably the NFL's best team isn't quite unbeatable. In spite of a 31-27 win over Green Bay on Sunday that pushed their record to a league-best 12-2 and all but clinched home-field advantage throughout the imminent AFC playoffs, the New England Patriots weren't pulling muscles patting themselves on the back in the aftermath. The AFC East leaders faced a first-time starting quarterback in the Packers' Matt Flynn, but nonetheless fell behind by 10 points early and had to rally again late to secure the four-point win. New England was also dominated in time of possession, with Green Bay controlling the ball for 40:48 to the Patriots' 19:12. "I thought [the Packers] were a very good football team, and they played like it," Patriots quarterback Tom Brady said. "These games are hard to win any way you're looking at them. They played very well. "From the opening kickoff, I knew that, okay, this is going to be one of those games. This is the way it's going to go." Brady passed for just 163 yards and was sacked three times, but connected on two scoring throws and extended his single-season league-record streak to 292 straight attempts without an interception. "I'm sure we lost the field position battle. And we overcame a bunch of penalties," he said. "I don't think we played our best game certainly, but I'm also very proud of the fact that we won the game." Specifically cited for praise by New England head coach Bill Belichick was defensive lineman Vince Wilfork, a seventh-year man from the University of Miami who was on the field for an unusually large number of plays (74) thanks to the Packers' clock domination and some Patriots injuries. Wilfork was credited with six tackles and recovered a Flynn fumble on teammate Tully Banta-Cain's sack on the final play of the game. "I thought Vince did a terrific job for us," Belichick said. "He was out there for a lot of plays -- 74 plays or whatever it was -- but it was a lot. I thought he played hard. He really had an outstanding game. "[The Packers] had a lot of attention directed at him, which is understandable, but he had a bunch of double-teams and slides on the protection coming his way and those types of things. He really played hard, played well, and did a lot of things to help us win. I thought he was outstanding, probably one of the best games he's played. He's played a lot of good ones, but I'd say that's one of the best ones he's played around here."
