I will work with Congress and our military to finally repeal the law that denies gay Americans the right to serve the country they love because of who they are

description.hltext_display: Ilala Mayor says inefficiency by council`s legal wing costly
description.content:
Jerry Slaa, the newly elected Mayor of Ilala in Dar es Salaam.
Jerry Slaa, the newly elected Mayor of Ilala in Dar es Salaam, said yesterday long-running wrangles over land in the municipality were due to failure by the local council’s legal department to execute its duties appropriately.
He made the remarks at a meeting in the city with ward councillors, directors and several other officials, noting that the department’s “failure to deliver as expected” had made the government lose a number of land and other cases in court.
Presenting a report on the challenges facing his office and ways to overcome them, the mayor said experience has shown that urban councils have been losing the cases mainly because their legal departments had failed to fight for public welfare.
He added that newly appointed Lands, Housing and Human Settlements Development minister Prof Anna Tibaijuka was having an especially hard time dealing with the problem “owing to lack of patriotism among some council officials”.
“Our own municipal council is wrestling with a number of land ownership and use cases simply because some people are invading open spaces for their own selfish interests, sometimes supported by council officials,” said Slaa.
“Some members of law-enforcement agencies have been fomenting or fuelling chaos instead of forestalling it and therefore, not only ensure that justice is done to all but also the council registers sound development,” he added.
He gave other problems resulting from poor enforcement of the laws as wrong parking of vehicles and the conducting of small business on street pavements and others in restricted areas, which inconvenience pedestrians and other road uses.
Ilala District Council legal officer John Mwanga responded by saying he had heard the mayor’s cry over the inefficiency of the legal department and would work on the challenges.
“I have heard the mayor’s concern that the department has made the council run into unnecessary financial and other problems by easily losing cases in the court. I will make sure that we work harder together from now on for the public interests,” he noted.
“The problems facing the council, especially with regard to legal issues, call for focused strategic planning and supports from councillors, other district officials and the citizenry if we are to speed up social and economic development,” he added.
Some councillors meanwhile underlined the need for the council to set its priorities rights in order to know where to start and where to end.
Prof Tibaijuka declared that the government is determined to recover all open spaces acquired or developed illegally because it was important that people respect city plans and the country’s laws.
She vowed to continue ensuring compliance with urban development plans, saying her responsibilities include helping the government to recover all illegally occupied open spaces.
Her crusade has however been met with resistance from some of the people who have “legally” acquired and developed open spaces.

description.hltext_display: Vidar Shipping köper Bravaden
Bengals place Owens on IR
description.content: Cincinnati, OH (Sports Network) - The Cincinnati Bengals made it official on Tuesday and placed wide receiver Terrell Owens on injured reserve. Owens suffered a torn meniscus in his left knee during this past Sunday's game against Cincinnati. He had originally hurt the knee during a December 5 contest against New Orleans. The 37-year-old veteran, in his first season in Cincinnati, was leading the Bengals with 72 receptions, 983 yards and nine touchdowns.

description.hltext_display: El Apra incluirá a 28 independientes en su lista al Congreso de la República
description.content:
De los 130 candidatos al Congreso de la República que presentará el Partido Aprista, 28 serán independientes y el resto será elegido en elecciones internas, afirmó la candidata de dicho partido a la presidencia de la República, Mercedes Aráoz.
Un sector de políticos independientes también apoya en la elaboración del plan de gobierno aprista, que ya tiene fecha de presentación, según añadió Aráoz Fernández. "El plan de gobierno lo debemos tener listo el 9 de enero, es la fecha que vamos a entregarlo, el equipo ya está trabajando, se trata de un grupo mixto, apristas e independientes", indicó Aráoz.
Al respecto, la candidata a la segunda vicepresidencia, Nidia Vílchez, sostuvo que el plan planteará reformar los programas sociales con el fin de que lleguen a la población más necesitada.
Vílchez y Aráoz estuvieron acompañadas en el programa "La hora N" por el postulante a la primera vicepresidencia de la plancha, Javier Velásquez Quesquén, quien dijo estar seguro de que el respaldo a la candidatura de la ex ministra de Economía crecerá y que pasará a la segunda vuelta.

description.hltext_display: Frankfurter Flughafen nach Schneechaos auf Weg zur Normalität
description.content:
vor 4 Min.
Nach dem Schneechaos der vergangenen Tage will Deutschlands größter Flughafen in Frankfurt am Main am Mittwoch weitgehend zum normalen Flugbetrieb zurückkehren. Angesichts des Tauwetters in der Rhein-Main-Region seien am Morgen bislang nur 70 Flüge gestrichen worden, sagte ein Sprecher der Flughafenbetreibergesellschaft Fraport. Die Start- und Landebahnen seien frei von Eis und Schnee. Am Dienstag seien bedingt durch die winterlichen Wetterverhältnisse noch 550 Flüge ausgefallen. Die Nacht auf Mittwoch hätten rund 300 Fluggäste in den Terminals des Frankfurter Flughafens auf Feldbetten verbracht.

description.hltext_display: HARD MONEY LOANS: AN INTRODUCTION
description.content:
A hard money loan is a specific type of asset-based loan financing through which a borrower receives funds that is secured by the value of a parcel of real estate. They are typically issued at much higher interest rates than conventional commercial or residential property loans and never issued by a commercial bank or other deposit institution.
Hard money loans are more expensive than traditional loans because they are not based upon traditional credit guidelines that protect investors and banks from high default rates as money lenders may not require the income verification that typical lenders require. Also, they experience higher default rates and, thus, charge a higher rate of interest. Individuals and companies may opt to take this kind of loan when they cannot obtain typical mortgage financing because they do not have acceptable credit or other documentation typically required by a conforming loan.
There are many advantages of utilizing hard money loans as these loans are readily available, when money is often tight with conventional loans. These loans are to close much faster and with less paperwork. This allows real estate investors to take quick advantage of good deals before other investors can.
If you decide that hard money loans are a good option for you, then the next step is applying for one. You must fill out a loan application much like a regular conventional loan and provide all relevant data on your financial situation as well as on the property. Include all relevant details on the deal in your loan package that will speed up the process. Hard money or private loans are more relational than regular loans, so take the time to build long-term relationships with private loan brokers and investors that will make the process smoother in the future if you have an existing relationship. This kind of loans varies greatly in fees and interest rates, so shop your loan around to get the best deal. As this kind of loan is always a risky venture, and it is always preferable to obtain the debt relief that can be negotiated by a qualified consultant. Seeking a hard money business loan is to try to settle existing financial problems just digs a deeper hole for your enterprise and it is better to get the advice of a skilled financial counselor who will advise you regarding the real options available to reorganize your financial obligations.
Lenders online offer equity funding do not all use investors for funding which means that investors do not have to approve the funding while some have other sources such as their own capital and major banks. These types of hard loans are easier to get an approval on and usually have a fast turnaround time on getting the fund. Getting pre approved through an online application makes the process faster. Online applications are usually easy to fill out but for assistance most sites have instant chat with an account representative or they may have a toll free contact number. Online applications through lenders online usually require the business name, phone number; start up date, type of business and email address.

Cowboys place Romo on IR
description.content: Irving, TX (Sports Network) - The Dallas Cowboys officially ended the season of quarterback Tony Romo, placing the starter on injured reserve. Romo hasn't taken a snap since October 25, when he suffered a fractured left collarbone in a 41-35 loss to the New York Giants. In six games this season, the Eastern Illinois product threw for 1,605 yards, 11 touchdowns and seven interceptions on 148-of-213 completions. Jon Kitna is expected to take the reins for the remainder of the schedule, a pair of road games at Arizona and Philadelphia. The Cowboys are 5-9, good enough for last place in the NFC East. To fill the roster spot, the Cowboys signed wide receiver Teddy Williams from the practice squad to the active roster.

Students collected various comfort items that will be sent to men and women serving in the military overseas. Participants, from left, are Linnae Homza, Key Club president; Christine Rutledge, Key Club adviser; Marissa Dushok; Krystina Hughes; Lisa Chihorek; Vicky Werkheiser; Lauren DeLuca; Karisa Calvitti, Key Club secretary; Sarah Connors, Key Club vice president; and Ronald Klepadlo, Key Club treasurer.

description.hltext_display: Carlos Bruce pidió a Mercedes Aráoz que espere hasta febrero para un debate en Bagua
description.content:
El legislador Carlos Bruce y el ex ministro del Interior Javier Reátegui, miembros de la fórmula presidencial de Perú Posible que encabeza Alejandro Toledo, consideraron que varios candidatos al sillón de Pizarro han "hecho márketing político" al adornar sus planchas con la presencia de mujeres, por ejemplo.
En una entrevista ofrecida al programa de TV ?Prensa Libre?, Bruce fue el primero en salir al frente ante las críticas que Toledo recibió por incluir solo a dos representantes de su partido, limeños y ex ministros de su gobierno, sin tomar en cuenta a ningún representante de provincias o a alguno de las agrupaciones políticas que la chacana tiene como alianza ( Somos Perú y Acción Popular).
"Toledo ha priorizado tener a su lado gente de su confianza, con la que ha trabajado, gente que tiene experiencia de Estado y que se podría hacer cargo del gobierno ante alguna enfermedad o lo que fuere del presidente", arguyó.
DEBATE CON ARÁOZ En relación con el debate que demanda a Toledo, la candidata del Apra, Mercedes Aráoz, así como los integrantes de su plancha, Bruce indicó que esto responde a una estrategia debido a la baja aceptación que la representante del partido de gobierno ha obtenido hasta ahora en los sondeos.
Según indicó, se trata de un "interés lógico, pues Aráoz no ha repuntado lo que el Apra quería".
Sobre el particular, Bruce acotó con ironía: "Si quiere un debate, lo va a tener, así como va a tenerlo con los demás candidatos en el mes de febrero, incluso le vamos a dar libertad de que ella elija el día y la hora pero que nos deje escoger el lugar. Yo creo que puede ser un sitio fuera de Lima, le propongo Bagua, vamos a discutir a Bagua .
En tanto, el parlamentario hizo un mea culpa a nombre del gobierno toledista (2001-2006) y reconoció que fue un error político el aumento de los sueldos del entonces presidente de la República así como de sus ministros.
No obstante, Bruce señaló que hubo aún un peor yerro de parte del gobierno aprista al reducir los salarios del personal técnico "que ha optado por "dejar al Estado sin gerencia".
"Cuando nos tocó ser gobierno duplicamos el sueldo de los maestros y no hubo un descalabro económico porque sabemos hacerlo. Otros no saben cómo hacerlo. Vamos a volver a hacerlo pero condicionado a su rendimiento", manifestó.
Finalmente, el actual secretario general de Perú Posible, Javier Reátegui, reveló que el candidato presidencial de Alianza para el Gran Cambio, Pedro Pablo Kuczynski, quiso aspirar a una de las vicepresidencias de la República representando a Perú Posible, pero "ya no había espacio".

description.hltext_display: Billy Ray Cyrus reportedly moving back to Nashville
description.content:
The singer is selling his marital home with now-ex Tish in LA.
DAILY ENTERTAINMENT PHOTOS: Get the Latest Celeb Gossip!
Billy Rayand Tish Cyrus are putting their family home on the market just three months after their split, according to reports.
The "Achy Breaky Heart" hitmaker and his wife filed for divorce in October, with both citing irreconcilable differences as they seek to bring their 17-year marriage to an end.
They have now decided to offload their marital home in Toluca Lake, Los Angeles - putting it up for sale for over $7 million, according to GossipCop.com.
The former couple married in 1992 and has three children together as well as three kids from previous relationships.
Billy Ray is allegedly eyeing a permanent move back to Nashville, where he's been since announcing his divorce form Tish.

description.hltext_display: Pink and fun and giving all over
description.content:
Share
One great thing that makes Durango such a giving community isn’t just that we’re loaded with nonprofits that make sure we don’t forget our neighbors. It’s that even as individuals, we find so many ways to make a difference.
That’s the case with Durango High School senior Chelsea McSparren, who took something that meant a lot to her personally – the quest for a cure for breast cancer, which has struck her grandmother, two aunts, three great-aunts and four cousins – and came up with a way for our community to help her work for the cause.
She had been thinking about doing something for a while, and when she learned that her mother’s college sorority, Zeta Tau Alpha, and its foundation also were involved in the cause, an idea was born: Collect Yoplait yogurt pink lids.
It’s a campaign that’s been going on for more than a decade, and I’m sure many a local individual has participated over those years. But Chelsea wanted to get us all on board. So she set up collection points at 16 locations around town, from both City Markets and Albertsons to the American Cancer Society and Walgreens. She even convinced the DoubleTree Hotel to switch the brand of yogurt it serves at breakfast to Yoplait during the campaign.
Yoplait increased its donation to the Susan G. Komen for the Cure to 10 cents a lid this year. And since 2004, it has donated 5 cents for every lid collected by a sorority member to the Zeta Tau Alpha Foundation, which supports breast-cancer causes and has for 18 years. Throw in the fact that Zeta Tau Alpha said its foundation would donate another 5 cents for every lid donated by a sorority member, and Chelsea could raise 20 cents for every one of those pink lids donated.
Then she added that old marketing tool, a competition, amped up to include school pride, pitting Miller and Escalante middle schools against each other. You might think middle school students wouldn’t be all that interested in collecting pink yogurt lids, but they went all out, bringing in more than 1,200 lids between the two schools.
Escalante won the bragging rights and the reward Chelsea had promised – an ice cream party for the whole school. We’re talking more than 500 people and a ton of ice cream and toppings. The students celebrated their victory Friday, a great send-off for the winter break.
Chelsea’s goal – which she considered a pretty aggressive one – was to collect 5,000 lids, which would raise $1,000. As of Monday, her total was 9,130 lids, or $1,826.
The project is also part of something Chelsea just became interested in this year, working toward her Gold Award from the Girl Scouts, the equivalent of an Eagle Scout designation from the Boy Scouts. She had been a Girl Scout when she was young, but came back to the organization as she learned about the Girl Scouts’ mission for girls to work with and be a part of their communities, a value she picked up from her parents, Lyle and Laura McSparren.
Chelsea doesn’t know where she’ll be attending college next year, but she does know she’s planning to study finance or some kind of business before going on to medical school to become a surgeon.
Oh – and she’s going to continue to organize collections of those pink lids wherever she ends up.
Drinking eggnog with their birthday cake are Eric Speck, Reg Graham, Jean Smith, Jennifer Houle, Claire Choate, Dianne Skinner, Jan Newlin, Sean McCardell, KeganMcCardell, Joseph Burns, Wendy Krull, Bob Kunkel and Ginna Harbison.
When I write the name “Evan Shinners,” music lovers will recall the gawky young man who drove us all to our feet in his performances here in 2003 and 2005.
He first came across our radar as the silver medalist in the Senior Division and the bronze medalist in the Concerto Division at the first Four Corners Piano Competition in the spring of 2003. Shinners returned twice – first to make his conducting debut with the Durango Choral Society (after only two lessons) and second to wow us out of our seats again when he returned after beginning his studies at The Juilliard School.
So it was only a bit of a surprise when Judith Reynolds showed me the front page of The New York Times Weekend Arts section dated Dec. 10. There was Shinners, in a photo that almost took up the entire page above the fold.
He’s part of a performance piece “Stop, Repair, Prepare: Variations on ‘Ode to Joy’ for a Prepared Piano,” which will be performed at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City through Jan. 10.
Shinners is playing the fourth and fifth movements of Beethoven’s Fifth Symphony from a circle cut out from inside the piano (in other words, backwards) while moving the piano in a choreographed routine around the second-floor atrium of the museum. Reviewer Roberta Smith wrote, “Evan Shinners attacked the score with a bravura that might have pleased Liszt (who originally transcribed it for two pianos, not two-thirds of one), while moving in a crab-walking spiral.”
To check out the photo and review, visit http://nytimes/2010/12/10/arts/design.
Celebrating their anniversaries with candlelight and sleigh rides are Martin and Charlotte Pirnat, Dorman and DottieMcShan, Jim and Janet Coloff, Delmar and Patricia Beard, Allen and Suzanne Washburn, Chris and Cheryl Bauer, Jim and Donna Aubrey, Brian and Shana Zink, Derek and Pam Snyder and Ray and Sue Walker.
SARAH FRIEDMAN/Herald
Durango High School senior Chelsea McSparren, who spearheaded a community-wide campaign to collect pink Yoplait yogurt lids to raise money for breast cancer research, said, “I’m pretty stoked about this. This is a lot bigger than I thought it would be.” She promised an ice cream social to the middle school that collected the most lids, and more than 500 students and staff at Escalante Middle School enjoyed their reward Friday.

description.hltext_display: God jul för vem?
description.content:
Dagligen hör vi hur bra ekonomi vi har. Anders Borg hyllas som ett geni men ”det är ingen konst att skita när häcken är full” som en bekant sade till mig och hänvisade till att Moderaterna fick en mycket bra ekonomi i arv från sossarna. Jag ska inte säga att allt som Borg har gjort är dåligt eller bra – det är snarare hur vi upplever Borgs ekonomi. Har jag fått 1 500 kronor mer i plånboken så är det klart bra. Har jag blivit utförsäkrad är det dåligt. Vi kan konstatera att Moderaterna har lyckats spela ut de svaga mot de starka i samhället och lyckats lägga skulden på de svaga. Faktum är att vi skulle ha kunnat genomföra de flesta skattesänkningar utan att ha försämrat A-kassa, socialförsäkringssystemen och pensionerna, för vår ekonomi är god, mycket god. Lika god som julskinkan som vi ska äta till jul – det vill säga, vi som har råd. Och till den tar vi en liten nubbe – inte T-röd utan gärna en Skåne.
Ekonomin är så bra att vi skulle kunna tillåta oss mer investeringar i hyresbostäder, infrastruktur, forskning, utbildning, lite fler händer i äldreomsorgen och ett och annat hem för hemlösa för ekonomin är säker, mycket säker just nu. Säker som våra hem. ”Mitt hem är min Borg”, skulle säkert vår gode finansminister säga när han hänger upp den sista julprydnaden i julgranen – under vilken en massa julklappar kommer att läggas och så kommer många av oss att ha det. Förutom många av de utförsäkrade men det är väl deras eget fel, eller? Jag kommer att njuta av julen och alla godsaker, hoppas att ni andra också gör det. Men om du ändå skulle få lite dåligt samvete över att just du har fått lite mer i plånboken, som du ännu inte har spenderat på julklappar (i år slås det nytt rekord inom julhandeln) för att du har turen att ha ett jobb, så kan du alltid skänka en slant till välgörenhetsorganisationer. För de har tagit över en stor del av ansvaret från Borg och staten för att hjälpa dem som inte har råd med en julskinka. ”Staten liknar en kastrerad katt: utan förmåga men ständigt tjockare” – Rüdiger Altman. God jul och gott nytt år. Lennart Rendik (V)

description.hltext_display: Barca & Messi chưa đủ "trình" đá ở Anh?
description.content:
Mời các bạn bấm ngay để xem tin h� ng ng� y về trên 24h. Hãy bấm đây để xem các b� n thắng kinh điển của LA LIGA

Ngôi số 1 thay đổi xo� nh xoạch qua từng vòng đấu, v� khoảng cách giữa các đội ở nhóm dẫn đầu chỉ hơn kém nhau 1 trận thắng. Tính khốc liệt v� căng thẳng của giải ngoại hạng Anh từ lâu đã được thừa nhận, v� với những người gi� u trí tưởng tượng, giả dụ nếu Messi v� Barca đang thi đấu ở Premier League liệu họ có thể dễ d� ng ghi b� n v� chiến thắng như thế?
Câu hỏi trên mới đây đã được một chuyên gia bóng đá h� ng đầu ở xứ sở sương mù, ông Andy Gray đưa ra lời giải đáp. Andy Gray l� một cựu cầu thủ nổi tiếng của Aston Villa v� Everton, v� hiện tại đang l� cây viết bình luận xuất sắc của Anh quốc. Andy cho biết: “Messi sẽ gặp rất nhiều khó khăn v� khó có thể thi triển những tuyệt kỹ của mình trước những đội bóng chơi phòng ngự rất rắn ở Premier League. Cậu ta sẽ phải chiến đấu để đương đầu với sự khắc nghiệt ở giải ngoại hạng”.
Gray lấy đơn cử một ví dụ như đội Stoke City, một đội nổi tiếng với lối chơi thể lực v� chém đinh chặt sắt. “Messi sẽ phát khiếp nếu thi đấu trên sân Britiannia (sân nh� của Stoke)”, chuyên gia n� y khẳng định. Tương tự l� với Barca, Andy Gray cũng cho rằng đội ĐKVĐ La Liga sẽ phải chiến đấu cật lực tại Premier League nếu muốn chiến thắng, bởi ở TBN họ chưa từng phải thi đấu với đội bóng n� o kiểu như Stoke, m� ở nước Anh những đội như thế không thiếu.
Chuyên gia 55 tuổi n� y cũng khẳng định rằng chất lượng của giải La Liga không thể so sánh với Premier League. Gray đưa ra bằng chứng rằng Ronaldo, cỗ máy ghi b� n hiện tại của Real đã gặp rất nhiều khó khăn để ghi b� n tại giải Ngoại hạng, ngoại trừ mùa giải bùng nổ 2007/2008. Nếu Messi sang đây, anh ta cũng sẽ phải “lao động hết mình” mới có thể ghi được b� n thắng. “Ronaldo có được th� nh công như ng� y hôm nay, chính l� vì cậu ấy đã được tôi luyện ở đấu trường khắc nghiệt như Premier League”, Gray quả quyết.
Chắc chắn những nhận định trên của Gray sẽ l� m dấy lên những luồng tranh cãi dữ dội trong cộng đồng fan hâm mộ. Mọi sự so sánh đều l� khập khiễng, nhất l� khi đó l� điều không thể xảy ra. Tuy nhiên ở một v� i khía cạnh, nhận xét của Gray không phải l� không có lý… Còn bạn, bạn có đồng ý với quan điểm trên?
Ý kiến của bạn về vấn đề n� y? Hãy gửi cho chúng tôi v� o hòm mail: bongda24h@24h.com.vn HIỆN NAY CHỈ 24H CÓ GIẤY PHÉP VIDEO , MỜI CÁC B� N THƯỜNG XUYÊN GHÉ THĂM VÀ THƯỞNG THỨC

description.hltext_display: IPP Media, donors award best ARU students in Dar
description.content:
IPP Media is among donors who joined hands in supporting Ardhi University (ARU) through different prizes to best students in the previous academic year.
ARU Deputy Vice-Chancellor (Academic Affairs) Prof Mengiseny Kaseva said recently that a total of 122 students who demonstrated outstanding performance in various courses received different awards from various firms.
Apart from IPP Media, other donors included Kahama Mining Corporation, Ministry of Communication, Science and Technology, Knight Frank, Tanzania Institution of Valuers and Estate Agents, Africa Property Ltd. and Proper Consult Ltd.
Others were Allan Mugisha, T.C Rwechungura, Professor Ebenezer Acquaye Memorial, Mrs Siwale, Horsens Polytechnic and Majengo Estates Developers Ltd.
According to the Don, the awarding ceremony was held at ARU campus in Dar es Salaam recently.
He said the prizes, over 187 of them, were designed to encourage students to build on their strengths and to achieve all-round excellence in the courses and nurturing of talents.
Prof Kaseva said the prizes were presented by ARU Vice-Chancellor Prof Idrisa Mshoro on behalf of the donors.
Among recipients of the prizes was Franella Halla from the School of Environmental Science and Technology, whose prize was provided by IPP media, Kahama Mining Corporation, Vice-Chancellor’s office and the Ministry of Communication, Science and Technology.
Commenting on the award, Franella said, “I’m very glad to receive this award, and express my sincere thanks to Mr. Reginald Abraham Mengi and other donors who have continued supporting me and other students by providing prizes to best students in various courses.”

Real-Mourinho: Sóng ngầm hay bão tố?
description.content:
Sau thất bại nhục nhã trước Barca, không như nhiều người tưởng thầy trò Mourinho đã đứng dạy một cách mạnh mẽ. 4 chiến thắng liên tiếp ở Liga v� Champions League đã cho thấy bản lĩnh của đội bóng do “người đặc biệt” dẫn dắt. Đặc biệt, chiến thắng tối thiểu trước Sevilla cuối tuần qua trong tình thế thiếu người (Carvalho bị đuổi v� Di Maria ghi b� n tuyệt đẹp) đã c� ng khẳng định đẳng cấp đội bóng lớn của Los Blancos.
Real vẫn chiến thắng, điều đó đồng nghĩa với việc Mourinho đã l� m tốt nhiệm vụ của mình dẫu cho ông đã chịu rất nhiều áp lực sau trận thua bẽ mặt trước Barca. Đã có nhiều nguồn tin cho rằng BLĐ CLB cũng như các madridista không còn tin tưởng tuyệt đối v� o chiến lược gia người Bồ, nhưng có lẽ sau khi suy đi tính lại thì cũng chẳng có ái có thể l� m tốt hơn Mou ở thời điểm n� y, vấn đề l� “người đặc biệt” cần thêm thời gian để xây dựng Real th� nh một tập thể thực sự vững mạnh, điều m� ông đã l� m rất tốt ở mùa giải thứ 2 dẫn dắt Inter trước khi chuyển sang Real đầu mùa giải năm nay. Vì thế Mou vẫn l� người m� Real rất cần v� o lúc n� y, nhưng mối quan hệ giữa vị chiến lược gia đầy cá tính n� y với BLĐ CLB đang thực sự có vấn đề. Mục tiêu của Real v� Mourinho l� ho� n to� n rõ r� ng, đó l� lật đổ sự thống trị của người Catalan tại Liga cũng như tìm lại ánh h� o quang tại châu Âu, tuy nhiên với những gì đang diễn ra tại Bernabeu thì đó còn l� một quãng đường d� i, thậm chí mối lương duyên giữa đội bóng Ho� ng gia Tây Ban Nha v� “người đặc biệt” đang gặp sóng gió dữ dội khi 2 bên không thống nhất được với nhau về vấn đề chuyển nhượng.
Với Mr Special, ông luôn muốn có to� n quyền quyết định trong vấn đề chuyển nhượng của đội bóng, tuy nhiên điều n� y xem ra quá khó có thể xảy ra ở Bernabeu. Tuần trước, đề xuất tăng cường thêm một tiền đạo của Mou đã bị BLĐ Real thẳng thừng từ chối m� trực trực tiếp l� TGĐ Valdano tuyên bố sẽ không có chuyện CLB chi tiền để mua thêm 1 tiền đạo. Theo Valdano, để mua 1 tiền đạo đẳng cấp trong tháng 1 l� rất khó hoặc sẽ phải chi rất nhiều tiền, hơn nữa trong tay Mourinho vẫn còn 1 tiền đạo tốt đó l� Benzema trong khi Higuain cũng sắp trở lại. Nhưng đó chỉ l� cái lý của Valdano, còn Mourinho tất nhiên không h� i lòng bởi h� ng công của Real hiện đang rất có vấn để khi chỉ có 1 mình Ronaldo chơi tốt, Higuain chưa rõ ng� y trở lại còn Benzema vẫn tiếp tục gây thất vọng.
Sự bất đồng trong nội bộ của Real được báo giới bình luận thông qua việc đề xuất của Mourinho bị khước từ. Ban đầu đó xem ra chỉ l� một vết rạn nhỏ, tuy nhiên với những gì vừa diễn ra thì đó không còn l� vết rạn hay sóng ngầm nữa m� rất có thể sẽ biến th� nh những cơn bão tố trong những ng� y sắp tới dù đây chính l� dịp đón Giáng sinh v� năm mới. Theo những thông tin mới nhất từ Bernabeu, ng� y hôm qua Mourinho đã thể hiện sự không h� i lòng của mình với BLĐ CLB bằng cách từ chối có mặt trong buổi họp báo bắt buộc trước trận Real – Levante tại Cup nh� Vua sẽ diễn ra v� o đêm nay. Mr Special không đưa ra bất cứ lý do n� o để giải thích cho việc vắng mặt v� chỉ cử trợ lý Aitor Karanka đi họp báo thay. Phải chăng đây l� một phản ứng của Mourinho để đáp lại quyết định của BLĐ Real? V� nếu đó thực sự l� một h� nh động chống đối của Mourinho với BLĐ CLB thì quả thực đó sẽ l� một vấn đề rất dễ gây hậu quả khôn lường cho đội bóng ở thời điểm rất quan trọng của mùa giải như hiện tại...

description.hltext_display: Real – Levante: Đánh nhanh thắng nhanh
description.content:
Mời các bạn bấm ngay để xem tin h� ng ng� y về trên 24h. Hãy bấm đây để xem các b� n thắng kinh điển của LA LIGA
Năm ngoái Real đã bị loại nhục nhã dưới tay của đội bóng vô danh Alcorcon, sang năm nay đội bóng ho� ng gia rất quyết tâm để xóa đi vết nhơ đó, trận thắng Real Murcia 5-1 ở vòng đấu trước đã phần n� o cho thấy khát vọng chiến thắng đó của th� y trò Jose Mourinho. Nhìn v� o danh sách đăng ký cho trận đấu với Levante đêm nay có thể thấy Kền kền đã sẵn s� ng cho một cuộc t� n sát đối thủ. Tất cả những hảo thủ ưu tú nhất đều có mặt từ thủ môn, hậu vệ, tiền vệ cho đến tiền đạo đều có những cái tên sáng giá nhất. Ngay cả Ronaldo, cầu thủ vừa bị sốt cũng có tên trong danh sách thi đấu. Rõ r� ng l� Mourinho muốn học trò giải quyết nhanh đối thủ ngay ở trận lượt đi để tránh những “hậu họa” đáng tiếc ở lượt về.
Kể từ sau trận đại bại trước Barca, Real vẫn cho thấy được phong độ rất tốt của mình. Họ vẫn vững v� ng về mặt tâm lý để không bị trượt dốc sau thất bại gây sốc trước đại kình địch. 4 chiến thắng liên tiếp trên các đấu trường sau trận siêu kinh điển đủ để giúp Real tiếp tục duy trì sự có mặt của mình ở các cuộc đua đến ngôi vô địch. Tuy nhiên có một vấn đề m� Real đang phải đối mặt đó l� sự thiếu sắc bén của các tiền đạo, điển hình l� trường hợp của Benzema trong bối cảnh Higuain vẫn phải dưỡng thương. Trọng trách gánh vác h� ng công v� ghi b� n đang phụ thuộc hơi thái quá v� o Ronaldo, người đã ghi 4 b� n trong 4 trận gần đây nhất của Kền kền. Khi Ronaldo bị khóa chặt, Real lập tức thi đấu bế tắc. Trận đấu với Sevilla đã cho thấy rõ điều đó. Rất may Los Blancos vẫn còn có các siêu sao biết tỏa sáng đúng lúc để giải cứu đội nh� . Đẳng cấp của Levante l� kém hơn so với Sevilla nên Real sẽ có một trận đấu dễ thở hơn rất nhiều.
Với đội khách Levante, sẽ không có nhiều hy vọng gì cho họ ở trận đấu n� y. Hiện tại tình thế của đội bóng ở La Liga đang rất bấp bênh v� chỉ cách nhóm đèn đỏ 2 điểm. Việc căng sức ở cả hai đấu trường có lẽ l� không thích hợp. Trước một đối thủ quá mạnh như Real, việc có để thua cũng l� điều tốt bởi họ có thể tập trung hơn cho mục tiêu chính ở đấu trường La Liga. Ở trận lượt đi tại La Liga, Levante đã gây ngạc nhiên lớn khi cầm hòa được Real với tỷ số 0-0 trên sân nh� . Chắc chắn b� i học về sự chủ quan sẽ được thầy trò Mourinho đúc rút để không bị sảy chân thêm lần nữa.
Khác với Barca dùng Cúp nh� vua để cho các cầu thủ trẻ thử sức, Real rất có thể sẽ tung ra sân đội hình mạnh nhất. Barca đã dùng các cầu thủ trẻ v� để cho Bilbao cầm hòa 0-0. Real chắc không muốn điều đó lặp lại, nếu như vậy một chiến thắng đậm cho th� y trò Mourinho l� ho� n to� n dễ hiểu. 24h dự đoán: 3-0
Đội hình ra sân dự kiến:
Real: Casillas, Lass Diarra, Pepe, Carvalho, Aberloa, Khedira, M. Diarra, Di Maria, Ozil, Ronaldo, Benzema
Levante: 1 Manuel 3 Victoriano Nano 18 Sergio Ballesteros 15 Asier Del Horno 2 David Cerrajeria 14 Xavi Torres 16 Sergio 20 Juanlu 24 Ignacio Gonzalez 19 Francisco Munoz Xisco 22 Christian Stuani

description.content: U slučaju pranja novca za koji je jedna banka iz Innsbrucka prijavila bivšeg hrvatskog premijera Ivu Sanadera, tereti se i jedna osoba koja je u rodu s njim, a spominje se i treća osoba, saznaje RTL Televizija.Nije poznato koja je to "osoba u rodu", pa ni je li riječ o Sanaderovom bratu Miroslavu, koji živi u Innsbrucku. Austrijanci obećavaju da će i Sanadera i rođaka ispitati, a druge detalje zbog interesa istrage ne žele iznositi. description.hltext_display: Tiket Pesawat ke Malaysia Nyaris Penuh
description.content:
Liputan6.com, Tangerang: Animo masyarakat Indonesia menyaksikan laga final pertama Piala AFF 2010 di Stadion Nasional, Bukit Jalil, Malaysia tampaknya cukup besar. Sejumlah maskapai penerbangan yang memiliki rute penerbangan Jakarta-Malaysia menyatakan tiket tujuan Negeri Jiran sudah hampir penuh hingga 26 Desember mendatang atau ketika digelarnya pertandingan antara Indonesia melawan Malaysia.
Khusus Garuda Indonesia, maskapai pelat merah itu bahkan menyiapkan empat penerbangan tambahan berkapasitas 1.000 tempat duduk. Empat ratus kursi di antaranya pesawat Boeing 747-400 yang akan berangkat dari Bandar Udara Soekarno-Hatta, Tangerang, Banten, 26 Desember mendatang pukul 10.00 WIB dan kembali dari malaysia pukul 11.00 waktu setempat. Tiga penerbangan lainnya pesawat jenis Boeing 737-300 yang akan berangkat dari Jakarta dan Surabaya, Jawa Timur.
Humas Garuda Tri Poetra I Sakti menambahkan, harga tiket penerbangan juga didiskon dari biasanya US$ 266 menjadi US$ 156 pulang pergi. Selain itu, para suporter akan langsung diangkut kendaraan dari Bandara Kuala Lumpur menuju Stadion Nasional, Bukit Jalil. Mereka juga bakal diberi kemudahan mendapatkan tiket menonton lantaran telah berkoordinasi dengan pihak Kedutaan Besar Indonesia di Kuala Lumpur.(BOG)

description.hltext_display: UK: Heathrow Airport reopens southern runway
description.content: The southern runway at Heathrow Airport has been reopened after four days. Thousands of passengers have been stranded at the airport since heavy snowfall on Saturday grounded planes, with 700 flights cancelled on Tuesday.Eurostar said it hopes to run a near normal service on Wednesday. Hundreds of people queued at St Pancras station overnight as services remain disrupted. There are also delays on several train routes serving London.A limited service is now operating on the East Coast route between Peterborough and London King's Cross, after it was suspended following severe damage to overhead power lines at Huntingdon. Heathrow Airport has seen cancellations with backlogs piling up as the weather conditions forced thousands of passengers to camp at the west London airport. A third of flights took off from the airport on Tuesday, and passengers have been advised only to travel to the airport if their flight has been confirmed to reduce congestion. Although the airport has been able to clear snow from the docking bays for aircrafts, BAA's chief executive Colin Matthews warned it could be some time before normal operations resume.

event_or_fact.property: Although the airport has been able to clear snow from the docking bays for aircrafts

description.hltext_display: Insatiable India Inc sealed record $55 bn M&A deals in 2010
description.content: Dhriti Ranjana Ray & Manoj RammohanNew Delhi, Dec 22 (PTI) Riding high on its insatiable appetite for foreign assets, India Inc announced merger and acquisition deals worth a record USD 55 billion this year, including a record number of billion-dollar transactions.As the year 2010 comes to a close, a look back at India Inc''s deal activity shows a splendid year, with the total deal value surpassing the previous record set in 2007 and big-ticket deals making a comeback as corporate India regained its deal-making appetite with nine billion-dollar-plus deals -- the highest-ever in a single year. ...

description.hltext_display: Mattel Rises 0.86% on Heavy Volume: Watch For Potential Pullback (MAT)
description.content:
Mattel (NYSE:MAT) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $25.62 to a high of $26.01. Yesterday, the shares gained 0.86%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $25.80 on volume of 2.7 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Mattel are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $24.43 and above their 200-day MA of $22.86. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Mattel in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on June 16, 2010 at $22.46. The stock has risen 14.2% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $25.80 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Toys & Games industry.
Keywords: mattel trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: Vrijeme liječi sve rane?
description.content: Ponekad slijed događaja u našem životu ne ide onim smjerom kojim bi mi željeli. Nešto što smo dugo gradili se uruši… prijateljstvo, veza, posao, ili bilo koji drugi životni cilj kojem težimo. Dio svakog života su i oni teški trenuci kada nas netko blizak napušta. Kako se nositi sa takvim situacijama? U trenutku negativnog događaja smo pod dojmom, subjektivizam i emocionalna povezanost prema osobi ili cilju nadvladava razum i objektivno sagledavanje činjenica. Reagiramo emotivno. Iako to ne moramo nužno uvijek ispoljavati prema okolini, u sebi patimo. Pesimizam nadjača bilo kakve druge osjećaje potiskujući ih u našoj svijesti...

description.hltext_display: Awas, Ada Tiket Palsu!
description.content:
Liputan6.com, Jakarta: PSSI menduga ada banyak tiket masuk palsu yang dijual oleh calo saat pertandingan semifinal Leg Kedua Piala Asean Football Federation atau AFF Suzuki Cup 2010. Demikian diungkapkan Bendahara PSSI Achsanul Qosasi di kantor PSSI Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (22/12).
Achsanul yang juga Wakil Ketua Komisi Sembilan Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat mengatakan tiket palsu itu sangat mirip dengan tiket yang dijual PSSI. Ia mengaku belum bisa mengatasi hal itu dengan menerapkan penjualan tiket melalui online secara keseluruhan karena terbatasnya kapasitas jaringan internet yang dimilikinya. PSSI baru bisa menjual tiket VVIP dan VIP melalui internet.
"Solusi mengatasi melalui penjualan online, namun baru tiket VVIP, VIP timur dan VIP Barat saja yang bisa," imbuh Achsanul.
Achsanul juga mengimbau agar penonton membeli tiket di loket resmi yang telah disediakan dan menghindari membeli tiket melalui calo. (Vin)

description.hltext_display: Population surge gives Texas 4 new US House seats
description.author: JAY ROOT
description.content:
AUSTIN, Texas
Texas is gaining four seats in the U.S. House, twice as many as Florida, the only other state to pick up multiple ones, according to new population figures announced Tuesday by the U.S. Census Bureau. All told, Republican-leaning states will pick up at least a half dozen House seats thanks to the 2010 census, which found the nation's population growing more slowly than in past decades but still shifting to the South and West.
With Texas Republicans using recent elections to fortify their already solid control of the state Legislature, the political process of redrawing the state's congressional map would seem to benefit the GOP, too.
But Democrats say not so fast.
Boyd Richie, chairman of the Texas Democratic Party, said Hispanic and black population growth account for the additional seats, and he vowed to fight for a redistricting plan that takes their numbers into account.
"A legal and fair redistricting process must produce new congressional districts that reflect the Hispanic and African American population growth," Richie said. "Our Democratic numbers may be down, but we are not out. Democrats cannot and will not allow our voices to be silenced in this critical process."
The Census Bureau said the nation's population on April 1 was 308,745,538, up from 281.4 million a decade ago. The growth rate for the past decade was 9.7 percent, the lowest since the Great Depression. The U.S. population grew by 13.2 percent from 1990 to 2000. Michigan was the only state to lose population during the past decade. Nevada, with a 35 percent increase, was the fastest-growing state.
The new numbers are a boon for Republicans, with Texas leading the way among GOP-leaning states that will gain House seats, mostly at the Rust Belt's expense. Following each once-a-decade census, the nation must reapportion the House's 435 districts to make them roughly equal in population, with each state getting at least one seat.
In all, the census figures show a shift affecting 18 states taking effect when the 113th Congress takes office in 2013. The political power follows the high population growth, shifting toward the south and west and away from the industrial Midwest and northeast.
With reapportionment settled, the far more politically divisive process of redistricting is set to begin. In Texas, both major parties were bracing for a showdown over the state's new residents, beginning a fight that is sure to spark court action. But with Republican supermajorities in the Legislature, the temptation to run the table will be strong.
Rep. Pete Gallego, D-Alpine, said if the federal courts don't intervene to compel fairness, Republicans will likely produce a map that gives their party the advantage in three or perhaps even all four of the new seats.
"It is very easy to overreach when you're holding the map and have the pen in your hand," he said.
Despite the party's recent gains in the November legislative elections, Republicans won't have unchecked authority to draw the state's congressional map to benefit themselves.
Civil rights laws require that the interests of minority voters be protected as district boundaries are redrawn, and Texas is one of the states whose redistricting plans require "pre-clearance" by federal authorities under the Voting Rights Act.
Democrats are also counting on an assist from the Obama administration, which could have a significant voice in the pre-clearance process. It is the first time since the Voting Rights Act passed that the Justice Department will be in Democratic hands during the redistricting process.
Hispanic growth doesn't automatically translate into Democratic growth, though. Two heavily Hispanic congressional seats in South Texas flipped to Republicans this year. There also are several new Latino GOP members about to be sworn into legislative seats.
South Texas Rep. Aaron Pena, who recently left the Democrat Party and became a Republican, said Texas Latinos are more conservative than their counterparts in western states such as California and Nevada.
Pena, who sits on the House Redistricting Committee, said his "educated guess" was that Republicans would get three of the four seats.
"The Hispanic community is increasingly up for grabs," Pena said. "It's truly a swing population."
Texas already had the largest Republican delegation in Congress, holding 20 of the state's 32 seats. In the 2010 elections, the party picked up another three seats, two of them in heavily Latino districts in South Texas. With all the new growth, Texas will now have 36 seats and 38 presidential electoral votes.
Federal lawsuits are essentially guaranteed as part of the process, and if the past is any guide, the courts will have a major say in how the lines are finally drawn. In 2001, the Texas Legislature deadlocked on Congressional redistricting, leaving the federal courts to redraw all the districts. In 2006, the U.S. Supreme Court ordered that new lines be drawn in several districts to protect the rights of Hispanic voters in South Texas.
Starting early next year, most state governments will use detailed, computer-generated data on voting patterns to carve neighborhoods in or out of newly drawn House districts, tilting them more to the left or right. Sometimes politicians play it safe, quietly agreeing to protect Republican and Democratic incumbents alike. But sometimes the party in control will gamble and aggressively try to reconfigure the map to dump as many opponents as possible.
The U.S. is still growing quickly relative to other developed nations. The population in France and England each increased roughly 5 percent over the past decade, while in Japan the number is largely unchanged, and Germany's population is declining. China grew at about 6 percent; Canada's growth rate is roughly 10 percent.
The 2010 census results also are used to distribute more than $400 billion in annual federal aid and will change each state's Electoral College votes beginning in the 2012 presidential election.
Apart from the respective four- and two-seat gains in Texas and Florida, Arizona, Georgia, Nevada, South Carolina, Utah and Washington are all picking up one new U.S. House seat. Ohio and New York will lose two House seats each. Losing one House seat are Illinois, Iowa, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

description.hltext_display: Give to the organizations you trust
description.content:
Share
As we near the end of another year, many people look to make charitable contributions. Here are a few things to consider when making your charitable contribution.
Most people report that the top reason they give to a particular charity is that they trust the organization. Nonprofit organizations can inspire trust by being transparent with financial information, by having a good board of directors overseeing the work and by measuring success.
Transparency with financial information can be achieved fairly easily in today’s electronic world. Most nonprofits have websites. The best organizations will post financial information there or, even better, will post its IRS reporting form and/or its annual audit. If the organization has a fairly small budget, it might not be able to afford an annual audit. In that case, an annual report that sums up the previous year’s financial information is a good substitute.

description.hltext_display: US Poised To Approve Nuclear Arms Pact With Russia
description.content:
9 Republicans Say They'll Back Treaty
DESMOND BUTLER, Associate Press
UPDATED: 1:06 am MST December 22, 2010
Images: Senate Votes To Close Debate On Nuke Pact
WASHINGTON -- The Senate is poised to approve a nuclear arms pact with Russia, handing President Barack Obama a huge victory on his top foreign policy priority.
Passage of the New START treaty appeared assured after 11 Republicans joined Democrats in a vote Tuesday to end debate on the pact. That signaled that Obama should have the two-thirds majority he needs when the Senate votes on final approval Wednesday.
The approval would mark a big comeback for Obama's arm controls efforts after the treaty appeared all but dead just weeks ago. It also would allow Obama to continue efforts to improve relations with Russia.
Ratification would mark a third recent major political victory for Obama, even though his Democratic party was trounced in last month's congressional elections. In recent days he won passage of a bipartisan tax deal and a vote ending the ban on gays openly serving in the military.
"We are on the brink of writing the next chapter in the 40-year history of wrestling with the threat of nuclear weapons," Foreign Relations Committee Chairman John Kerry, a Democrat, said after the vote.
The treaty would limit each country's strategic nuclear warheads to 1,550, down from the current ceiling of 2,200. It also would establish a system for monitoring and verification. U.S. weapons inspections ended last year with the expiration of a 1991 treaty.
The administration was adamant that it be ratified this year because the Democrats' majority in the Senate is set to shrink by five in January and waiting could have meant months of delay or defeat.
Republicans accused Democrats of rushing approval of the treaty for political reasons. They have asserted it would limit U.S. missile defense options and argued it has insufficient procedures to verify Russia's adherence.
When Jon Kyl, the leading Republican on negotiations over the treaty, suggested a delay last month, Obama appeared unlikely to find the nine Republican votes needed for passage.
But he and top members of his administration lobbied intensely, with Obama postponing his Christmas vacation in Hawaii. They enlisted support from top military officials and big-name Republicans from past administrations who argued the treaty was essential for U.S. national security.
In the end, they persuaded enough Republicans to defy the party's top two leaders in the Senate and support the pact.
"We know when we've been beaten," Republican Sen. Orrin Hatch told reporters hours before Tuesday's vote.
Even the Senate's No. 3 Republican, Lamar Alexander, endorsed the accord, saying he was assured U.S. defenses would not be weakened.
The treaty will leave the United States "with enough nuclear warheads to blow any attacker to kingdom come," Alexander said on the Senate floor.
Republicans had tried to kill the treaty by forcing changes in its language that would have sent it back for negotiations with Moscow. Democrats were working to appease some Republican senators by letting them raise these issues in legislation accompanying the treaty that would not directly affect the treaty.
Most Republicans remained opposed.
"The administration did not negotiate a good treaty," Kyl said. "They went into the negotiations it seems to me with the attitude with the Russians just like the guy who goes into the car dealership and says, 'I'm not leaving here until I buy a car.'"
Though Kyl looks likely to vote on the losing side of the debate over the treaty, in his negotiations with the administration he did win Obama's commitment to modernize the remaining nuclear arsenal with projected spending of $85 billion over 10 years.
Some of that money is now in the pipeline, contained in a stopgap government funding bill that cleared Congress on Tuesday. The measure would finance the government, mostly at current levels, through March 4.
It makes an exception for nuclear security programs, allowing the government to spend money to modernize the United States' nuclear arsenal at a rate equal to Obama's $624 million request.

description.hltext_display: Ambitious `high-yield` seed project in the offing
description.content:
Prof Jumanne Maghembe
The government plans to embark on a major project geared to producing enough high-yield seeds in a fresh bid to meet the country’s growing demand for quality seeds.
Agriculture, Food Security and Cooperatives minister Prof Jumanne Maghembe made the plan public yesterday during his official visit to Selian Agricultural Research Institute (Sari) based here.
The minister explained that the government would involve all stakeholders, including seeds research centres and companies producing the input, in designing a new system that would ensure quality high-yield seeds are available for all farmers in need of them.
According to Maghembe, currently the country needs about 120,000 tonnes of high-yield seeds. However he said, only 30,000 tonnes were being produced and about 5,000 tonnes were used by farmers.
“Kilimo Kwanza initiative will not be achieved if our farmers will continue using traditional seeds,” he said, informing that implementation of the plan would begin next year.
“We have tried to sensitize farmers to use fertilizers, but we’ve not promoted the use of improved seeds for higher outputs. It is clear that applying fertilizers without quality seeds won’t help the farmers earn much. So, we need to seriously work on this area by ensuring that farmers have access to quality seeds,” the minister explained.
According to him, three quarter of maize farmers in the country rely on traditional maize seeds, which provide poor results.
Meanwhile, Prof Maghembe commended Sari for its role in developing nine improved maize varieties in the market, calling other research centres and seed producing firms to borrow a leaf.
“The plan will also empower local seed producers to improve the quantity of seeds they produce,” he added. The Minister also expressed optimism that availability of quality and high-yielding seeds would help a great deal in supporting the private sector engage in commercial farming.
He also informed that the government plans to transform Sari into an independent institute in a bid to improve its core duty of offering effective agricultural research services.
Earlier, acting director of Agricultural Research and Training for the Northern Zone, Dr. Mboyi Mugendi said that, Sari has developed nine maize species and four bean species, which most of them are drought and disease resistant.
He however cited shortage of researchers as the main challenge hindering the development of the institute as most of those working with the centre were about to retire.

description.hltext_display: Skokine ženstvene dive bez premca
description.content:
Ivica Skoko iza sebe ima 12-godišnju karijeru tokom koje je žene pretvorio u nedodirljive dive koje zrače ženstvenošću i nigdje ne prolaze nezamijećeno. Njegov zaštitni znak su elegantne haljine, a vječnu inspiraciju pronalazi na crvenom tepihu.
S nasmijanim dizajnerom susreli smo se u kafiću pored njegove trgovine u Vlaškoj 79 u Zagrebu, gdje smo hladnoću zimskog dana razbili toplom kavom i ugodnom atmosferom. Nezaobilazna tema je bila njegova posljednja kolekcija predstavljena na Dove Fashion.hr-u kao i najupečatljiviji trenuci njegove karijere, no rado smo popričali i o važnosti obitelji, prijatelja i partijanja do ranih jutarnjih sati...

description.hltext_display: Make sure good nutrition supports your long life
description.content:
Share
The U.S. population is aging. The majority of residents are middle-aged or older (older than 45 years), and the ratio of older people to young is increasing.
The fastest growing age group is the older than 85 sector. Since 1950, their numbers have increased sevenfold.
Life expectancy in the U.S. also has risen – to 81 years for white women, 76 years for black women, 75 years for white men and 69 years for black men. In 1900, life expectancy was a mere 47 years for most people.
Good nutrition has long been associated with longevity, but the questions still being asked are “what role does nutrition play in the aging process, and what role can it play in slowing aging?” Aging is an inevitable and natural process, but it can be slowed (within genetic limits; the oldest age it is thought humans could possibly live is 130 years) by healthy lifestyle behaviors and good nutrition throughout life. Good nutrition can also improve our quality of life, especially as we age.
One of the most important outcomes of eating a healthy diet affects us more as we age – weight gain. Keeping a healthy weight throughout your adult life will improve your chances of living longer and lower your risks for most types of chronic disease, such as cancer, heart disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, stroke and arthritis. As we age, most people gain weight slowly, maybe 5 pounds per decade, but this creeping weight gain affects our health and quality of life. Two-thirds of adults in the U.S. are overweight or obese, and the older we get, the more we tend to lose bone and muscle and gain body fat. Hormones that regulate appetite and metabolism decrease and become less active with age, so it’s more important to eat healthy and decrease the amount of calories eaten the older we get.

description.hltext_display: Bret Michaels is engaged
description.content:
After dating on-again/off-again girlfriend Kristi Gibson for sixteen years, the rocker finally put a ring on it.
The Rock of Love bus can officially be retired, . On last night's episode of Michaels' latest VH1 hit, Bret Michaels: Life As I Know It, the Poison star popped the question to his girlfriend of sixteen years, Kristi Gibson.
When Gibson looked on in disbelief, Michaels pleaded with her to give him an answer. "Please say yes or the rejection will kill me right now," he said. After a few seconds, Michaels got the answer he was looking for.
We predict a new VH1 series as the couple makes plans to head to the altar.

description.hltext_display: China's State Grid pays nearly $1 billion for Brazilian electricity assets, 30-year concession
description.content:
SHANGHAI - China's biggest electricity company, State Grid, says it is paying $989 million for seven Brazilian power companies and their transmission lines as it seeks to expand overseas.
The investment includes a 30-year concession to operate the Brazilian power grids that can be renewed for 20 years once it expires, according to a notice seen Wednesday on the website of the Chinese government agency that manages state assets.
The deal marks a further expansion of State Grid into overseas markets following a $3.9 billion, 25-year contract with the Philippines to run that country's power grid.
Though not well known abroad, State Grid says it is ranked eighth among the Fortune 500 and operates power lines across 26 of China's 32 provinces and regions. It is among many state-owned businesses that are heeding the government's call to "go out" by investing overseas.
The investment in Brazil will suit the "strategic co-operation" between the two countries and is expected to yield an average annual profit of $110 million, State Grid said.
Brazil relies heavily on power from Itaipu, the world's second-largest hydroelectric dam after China's Three Gorges. It has faced intermittent blackouts in recent years, though the government says it has invested heavily in transmission lines since President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva took office in 2003.
State Grid's own networks are facing troubles over shortages of coal and gaps in demand and supply that oblige many cities to ration or cut power. Wide areas were left without power nearly three years ago due to icy winter weather that downed transmission lines and towers in central China.

description.hltext_display: Lindsay Lohan accused of 'battery' at rehab clinic
description.content:
The troubled star allegedly pushed a care worker, but sources say Lindsay did not start the altercation.
DAILY ENTERTAINMENT PHOTOS: Get the Latest Celeb Gossip!
Lindsay Lohan is reportedly at the center of a police probe amid allegations she assaulted a staff member at California's Betty Ford clinic.
It emerged today that officers in Palm Desert, California are investigating after a female member of the Betty Ford staff was assaulted during an altercation with Lohan and some pals, according to TMZ.com.
Cops received a call at 1:03am on December 10 for "hand-to-hand battery" - but a source tells the website Lohan was not the perpetrator of the incident.
The troubled actress insists she didn't strike the first blow and merely pushed back at the unnamed member of staff after she was "unfairly" lectured about arriving at the home after her curfew and ordered to take a drug or alcohol test, according to TMZ.
The website claims Lohan yelled, "Take your hands off of me" as the drama escalated, and then "pushed back" against the woman.

description.hltext_display: NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development Inaugurated
description.content:
TAINAN, Taiwan To elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency and achieve academic excellence, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) of National Cheng Kung University (NCKU), Tainan, Taiwan, is inaugurated on December 22nd in 3rd floor, Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus.
“The most important function of a university is education, cultivating talents, and then research and social service. It is a university’s mission to educate youth of the next generation. Education should include two aspects, teaching and learning. However, we mainly focus on the teaching of professors, neglecting the learning of students, which is allowing students to absorb as much knowledge as they can,” said President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai of National Cheng Kung University in his opening remark.
President Lai also mentioned, “National Cheng Kung University had established Center for Faculty Development which focused solely on the cultivation of teachers. Thus, I believe the newly inaugurated Center for Teaching and Learning Development must embody both aspects of teaching, developing teaching methods, and learning, discovering questions, raising questions and finding solutions. I believe this is the essence of education and the development direction of the future education of National Cheng Kung University.”
NCKU Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung revealed, “I am pleased to see that Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang has established the Center for Teaching and Learning Development. As I have often said, outstanding talents cannot be cultivated without excellent education, and universities cannot transform into top universities without outstanding talents.” Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung also explained, “As graduates return to their alma mater, they do not recall how wonderful a professor’s research is and they only remember how strict the teaching of a professor is. Students’ parents also do not consider how renowned a professor is in the research field and they only care about how well their children can learn from the school. Therefore, a university, especially a top university, needs to take both teaching and learning into account.” Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung stated, “In Taiwan, teachers often teach what they like and students often learn what they want. This is incorrect. As teachers devote themselves into teaching, they must observe the learning efficiency of the students from a different perspective. I hope the Center for Teaching and Development Learning can spread the concept for the teachers to realize the importance of education.”
NCKU Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang said, “After four years of efforts, Center for Teaching and Learning Development finally inaugurated today. For the past years, under the goal set by President Lai, the Office for Academic Affairs has devoted itself to humanistic and innovative education and cross-disciplinary learning. We are excited that the Center for Teaching and Learning Development, established to truly integrate all the resources at NCKU and to promote NCKU to a top university, is finally inaugurated.” Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang also said, “We have visited research and teaching universities in The United States years ago, realizing that their centers for teaching and learning development have abundant resources, and we have also visited National Taiwan University and Chung Yuan Christian University, discovering that the former lacks integration and the latter lacks manpower. With the advantages of integrated resources and unified manpower as our foundation, I believe National Cheng Kung University can become an internationally top university in the future.”
The newly inaugurated NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development is located on the 3rd floor of Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus, and NCKU President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai, Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung, Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang, Director of Center for Teaching and Learning Development J. J. Wang, Director of Center for General Education Wei-Yung Wang, Secretary General Woei-Shyan Lee, other directors, deans and dozens of personnel have attended the inauguration ceremony.
The NCKU Center for Faculty Development, established in 2006, aims to strengthen the professional teaching ability of teachers and teaching assistants; however, to achieve academic excellence and innovation and elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) is established.

description.hltext_display: SmarTrend Watching for Potential Pullback in Shares of Whiting Petroleum After 2.91% Gain (WLL)
description.content:
Whiting Petroleum (NYSE:WLL) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $114.45 to a high of $117.71. Yesterday, the shares gained 2.91%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $114.87 on volume of 569,000 shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Whiting Petroleum are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $107.10 and above their 200-day MA of $91.24. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Whiting Petroleum in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 03, 2010 at $91.51. The stock has risen 24.8% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $114.87 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Oil & Gas- Drilling and Exploration industry.

description.hltext_display: Сверхмалогабаритный «компьютер-на-модуле» Kontron nanoETXexpress-TT с Intel Atom серии E6xx для Е2
description.content:
Новый продукт объединил в себе ряд ключевых инновационных технологий. Во-первых, этот продукт является первым модулем в сверхмалом формфакторе (55 x 84 мм), который полностью совместим с международным стандартом COM Express и оснащен новейшим процессором Intel Atom серии E6XX.
Во-вторых, 220-контактный разъем nanoETXexpress-TT соответствует спецификации COM.0 Type 10, ставшей дополнением к обновленной и ратифицированной консорциумом PICMG версии стандарта COM Express Rev.2.0. В-третьих, модуль изготовлен на основе промышленных компонентов, предназначенных для работы в расширенном температурном диапазоне E2 (от -40 до +85C) и жестких условиях эксплуатации. В дополнение к этому nanoETXexpress-TT может иметь четыре варианта исполнения: с тактовой частотой процессора от 600 МГц до 1,6 ГГц.
NanoETXexpress-TT спроектирован для применения во всех сегментах рынка, где энергоэффективные сверхкомпактные компьютеры подвергаются экстремальным температурам и высоким вибрационным нагрузкам. Прежде всего, это оборонные применения, энергетика, промышленная автоматизация, транспорт. В качестве примеров возможного использования nanoETXexpress-TT следует упомянуть защищенные портативные мини-терминалы с питанием от батарей или от солнечной энергии, контроллеры ветроэнергетических установок, защищенные встроенные мини-компьютеры для «умных» счетчиков (smart meters), а также информационные или управляющие приложения в сочетании с ГЛОНАСС/GPS на транспортных средствах.
Перспективный формфактор nanoETXexpress пользуется популярностью у разработчиков компактных устройств, заинтересованных в высоком уровне стандартизации и масштабируемости технологий COM Express. Новый модуль Kontron в одноименном формфакторе, совместимый с COM Express COM.0 R.2 Type 10, открывает путь будущим проектам на основе x86-архитектуры, где требуется высокая энергоэффективность, наименьшие габариты и специализированные интерфейсы. Технология «компьютеров-на-модуле» nanoETXexpress позволяет инженерам реализовывать уникальные проекты в короткие сроки без необходимости проектирования вычислительного ядра.
NanoETXexpress-TT на 100 процентов совместим с новым разъемом COM Express Type 10, утвержденным в стандарте COM Express COM.0 R.2. Кроме LVDS, в нем предусмотрен новый цифровой дисплейный интерфейс (DDI) для реализации на его основе SDVO, Display Port или HDMI с возможностью управления двумя независимыми дисплеями. По сравнению с решениями на Intel Atom серии Z5xx, на 50 процентов увеличилась скорость обработки 3D-графики. Пользователи также могут использовать преимущества нового последовательного интерфейса SPI (Serial Peripheral Interface), обеспечивающего процесс загрузки BIOS с внешних носителей, ранее такая загрузка была возможна только по шине LPC.
«Компьютер-на-модуле» nanoETXexpress-TT оснащен контроллером-концентратором Intel Platform Controller Hub EG20T. Поэтому, кроме трех каналов PCI-Express, на модуле предусмотрено два варианта хранения данных:
а) надежный разъем micro-SD (для накопителя до 32 ГБ) и два интерфейса SATA II 300 МБ/с;
б) установленная промышленная флеш-память SATA (до 16 ГБ) и один интерфейс SATA II 300 МБ/с.
На версию модуля с установленной промышленной флеш-памятью опционально может наноситься конформное покрытие для защиты от влаги и электромагнитных излучений. В качестве дополнительной опции также предусмотрена поддержка САN-интерфейса, например для транспортных применений.
Устройство может быть оборудовано процессорами Intel Atom серии E6XX с тактовой частотой 600 MГц, 1,0 ГГц, 1,3 ГГц, 1,6 ГГц, имеет встроенную оперативную память DDR2 объемом 2 ГБ и коннектор для карты micro-SD в качестве загрузочного носителя. Через разъем COM Express Type 10 на модуле реализованы два последовательных интерфейса, новый интерфейс Digital Display Interface (DDI), конфигурируемый только как SDVO, одноканальный LVDS 18/24-бит. Кроме того, от разъема COM Express Type 1 унаследован Gigabit Ethernet, 6x USB 2.0 (один USB-клиент), 1x CAN (опционально) и 3х PCI-Express x1 для специализированных расширений. На nanoETXexpress-TT установлен внешний мост PCIe-to-PCI. Для использования малоформатных устройств SD/SDIO, например micro-SD, MMC или IDE-ATA, GPIO необходимо всего лишь изменить настройки BIOS.
Дополнительную информацию о nanoETXexpress-TT можно получить на сайте компании Kontron.

description.hltext_display: NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development Inaugurated
description.content:
TAINAN, Taiwan--(BUSINESS WIRE)--To elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency and achieve academic excellence, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) of National Cheng Kung University (NCKU), Tainan, Taiwan, is inaugurated on December 22nd in 3rd floor, Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus.
"I am pleased to see that Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang has established the Center for Teaching and Learning Development. As I have often said, outstanding talents cannot be cultivated without excellent education, and universities cannot transform into top universities without outstanding talents.”
"The most important function of a university is education, cultivating talents, and then research and social service. It is a university’s mission to educate youth of the next generation. Education should include two aspects, teaching and learning. However, we mainly focus on the teaching of professors, neglecting the learning of students, which is allowing students to absorb as much knowledge as they can," said President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai of National Cheng Kung University in his opening remark.
President Lai also mentioned, "National Cheng Kung University had established Center for Faculty Development which focused solely on the cultivation of teachers. Thus, I believe the newly inaugurated Center for Teaching and Learning Development must embody both aspects of teaching, developing teaching methods, and learning, discovering questions, raising questions and finding solutions. I believe this is the essence of education and the development direction of the future education of National Cheng Kung University."
NCKU Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung revealed, "I am pleased to see that Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang has established the Center for Teaching and Learning Development. As I have often said, outstanding talents cannot be cultivated without excellent education, and universities cannot transform into top universities without outstanding talents." Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung also explained, "As graduates return to their alma mater, they do not recall how wonderful a professor’s research is and they only remember how strict the teaching of a professor is. Students’ parents also do not consider how renowned a professor is in the research field and they only care about how well their children can learn from the school. Therefore, a university, especially a top university, needs to take both teaching and learning into account." Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung stated, "In Taiwan, teachers often teach what they like and students often learn what they want. This is incorrect. As teachers devote themselves into teaching, they must observe the learning efficiency of the students from a different perspective. I hope the Center for Teaching and Development Learning can spread the concept for the teachers to realize the importance of education."
NCKU Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang said, "After four years of efforts, Center for Teaching and Learning Development finally inaugurated today. For the past years, under the goal set by President Lai, the Office for Academic Affairs has devoted itself to humanistic and innovative education and cross-disciplinary learning. We are excited that the Center for Teaching and Learning Development, established to truly integrate all the resources at NCKU and to promote NCKU to a top university, is finally inaugurated." Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang also said, "We have visited research and teaching universities in The United States years ago, realizing that their centers for teaching and learning development have abundant resources, and we have also visited National Taiwan University and Chung Yuan Christian University, discovering that the former lacks integration and the latter lacks manpower. With the advantages of integrated resources and unified manpower as our foundation, I believe National Cheng Kung University can become an internationally top university in the future."
The newly inaugurated NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development is located on the 3rd floor of Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus, and NCKU President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai, Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung, Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang, Director of Center for Teaching and Learning Development J. J. Wang, Director of Center for General Education Wei-Yung Wang, Secretary General Woei-Shyan Lee, other directors, deans and dozens of personnel have attended the inauguration ceremony.
The NCKU Center for Faculty Development, established in 2006, aims to strengthen the professional teaching ability of teachers and teaching assistants; however, to achieve academic excellence and innovation and elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) is established.

description.hltext_display: Pričaj mi priču...
description.content:
,, '', zna li vam to ponekad dijete reći ili se možda sjećate da ste vi kao dijete znali i to zatražiti, poželjeti od odraslih?
Priče i bajke sastavni su dio svakog djetinjstva, a vole ih i odrasli. S obzirom na važnost pričanja u razvoju djeteta psiholozi navode da one omogućuju emocionalni i duhovni rast djeteta. Priče su odavno priznate kao sredstvo za oblikovanje djetetovog života. To je jedan od najjednostavnijih načina da učimo dijete o vrijednostima i vrlinama. Mnogi ljudi nisu svjesni važnosti pričanja priča, ali istina je da ono izravno utječe na način na koji dijete razmišlja, govori i na način na koji se dijete ponaša...

description.hltext_display: Try this one new, easy money habit for next year
description.content:
Keywords: Economy, business and finance,
Share
This month, you have the opportunity to create a new habit that will both save you money and improve your health. You’re going to tackle the largest discretionary spending category in your budget: groceries.
Discretionary spending encompasses all the purchases you can pay for immediately. This type of spending is different from an obligation. An obligation is an agreement or contract to pay off a debt or to make a repeat purchase over a period of time. For example, an ATV would be a discretionary purchase until a loan is taken out to buy it, then the loan becomes a monthly obligation.
The larger your discretionary spending budget can be the better. This allows you to pay cash for purchases and gives you flexibility if your income changes. Paying cash can keep you out of debt. Once you charge a purchase to a credit card, it becomes an obligation, and statistics show that when you pay with a credit card, you’re likely to spend 12 to 30 percent more than when you pay cash.

description.hltext_display: India offers scholarship to 25 Tanzanians
description.content:
The Indian government has offered scholarships to 25 Tanzanians to pursue different short courses in India.
Indian Ambassador to Tanzania Kocheril Bhagirath yesterday gave air tickets to the respective individuals to India for studies. They are expected to travel in batches, starting from January next year.
Those who received the tickets in Dar es Salaam yesterday included Godwin Aggrey, Rune Nathaniel, Hassan Nassoro, Nestory Malima, Edith Yesaya, Gibson Rodrick, Samwel Lucas, Agnes Boniface, Foibe Zawadi and Alex Cunith.
Others are Lusekelo Edwin, Jacqueline Herbert, Goima Peter, Robert Deusdedith, Masaki Albano, Roida Andisamile, James Mutakya, Lumuli Alexander, Savera Salvatory, Julius Francis, Romanius Lwena, Shakiru Yusuph, Zakaria David and Violet Siame.
Tanzanians, who got the scholarships, were drawn from the public and private sectors.
Speaking during the function, an official, who represented the permanent secretary in the President's Office (Public Services Management), Faisal Issa, urged the Tanzanians to share the knowledge gained in India with other Tanzanians.
“These people have a moral obligation to ensure that their knowledge benefits many Tanzanians in both urban and rural settings. Try to be responsible citizens by sharing what you have learnt with other Tanzanians,” Issa noted.
He said most of those who got the chance to go abroad needed to study hard and live decently during the training programme in order for them to be good ambassadors.
“If you don’t do that, you will perform poorly in class and thus shame your country (Tanzanians) before the eyes of other nationals in the world. At the end of the course if you come with good results, you will make all Tanzanians proud. Even you (those who got the sponsorships) will be proud of your own academic achievements,” he said.
Meanwhile, Bhagirath said the scholarship programme was part of his country's strategy to consolidate friendly relations between the two countries.“Such opportunities are offered annually. So, the people who need scholarship are required to read newspapers daily,” he noted.
