description.hltext_display: Chronology of news events in 2010
description.content:
U.N. Security Council , Continental Airlines Inc. , Air France , U.S. , South Korea , North Korea
Dec. 1
—As the U.S. and South Korea end war manoeuvrs after North Korea's deadly bombing of a front-line island, a North Korean soldier at the heavily armed border says he hopes for peace.
Dec. 2
—U.N. experts say a scorching summer that killed thousands in Russia and exceptionally mild winter temperatures in the Arctic are among weather events that have put 2010 on track to be among the three hottest years ever.
Dec. 3
—President Barack Obama tells cheering U.S. troops in Afghanistan they are succeeding in their mission fighting terrorism, but foul weather prevents him from meeting with President Hamid Karzai to address frayed relations.
Dec. 4
—Spain places striking air traffic controllers under military authority and threatens them with jail terms in an unprecedented emergency order to get planes back in the sky and clear chaotic airports clogged with irate travellers.
Dec. 5
—Mexico's foreign secretary tells the global climate conference there will be "no hidden text, no secret negotiations" in the meeting's final days assuring delegates Cancun will not see a repeat of 2009's Copenhagen climate summit.
Dec. 6
—Talks between Iran and six world powers recess with no sign Tehran is ready to discuss U.N. Security Council calls to curb its nuclear activity that could be harnessed to make weapons.
Dec. 7
—Continental Airlines Inc. and one of its mechanics are convicted in a French court of manslaughter because debris from one of its planes caused the crash of an Air France supersonic Concorde jet that killed 113 people a decade ago.
Dec. 8
—A fire that started during an inmate brawl sweeps through an overcrowded prison in Chile, killing at least 81 people and seriously injuring 14.
Dec. 9
—Furious students attack a car carrying Prince Charles and his wife, Camilla, vandalize buildings and battle riot police as a hike in university tuition fees triggers Britain's worst political violence in years.
Dec. 10
—With his Nobel Peace Prize and medal placed in an empty chair, imprisoned Chinese dissident Liu Xiabo gets a standing ovation at the award ceremony in Oslo as dignitaries demand his release.
Dec. 11
—A U.N. conference adopts a modest climate deal, creating a fund to help the developing world go green though it deferred for another year the tough work of carving out deeper reductions in carbon emissions causing the earth to steadily warm.
Dec. 12
—Incumbent Prime Minister Hashim Thaci claims victory in Kosovo's first general election since the province declared independence from Serbia.
Dec. 13
—Iran's president abruptly fires his foreign minister and names the nuclear chief as his top diplomat, the latest sign of a rift at the top levels of the Islamic theocracy as the country faces intense pressure from the West over its nuclear program.
Dec. 14
—Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi pulls off another escape from the political dead, scrapping through two parliamentary votes of no confidence, but his hold on power remains precarious and political gridlock is a near certainty.
Dec. 15
—Police detain more than 1,000 people in Moscow and several other Russian cities in an attempt to prevent more clashes between racist hooligans and mostly Muslim ethnic minorities after earlier rioting in the capital left dozens injured.
Dec. 16
—Forces loyal to the two men claiming to be president of the Ivory Coast clash in the streets of the commercial capital Abidjan, killing at least 20 people and bolstering fears the world's largest cocoa producer is on the verge of a new civil war.
Dec. 17
—The CIA pulls its top spy out of Pakistan after threats were made against his life, an unusual move for the U.S. and a complication on the front lines of the fight against al-Qaida.
Dec. 18
—Military manoeuvrs planned by South Korea do not take place because of bad weather on a border island shelled by North Korea last month as the U.N. Security Council schedules an emergency meeting at Russia's request amid concerns over rising tensions on the divided peninsula.

description.hltext_display: Wieder Geldbeutel aus Einkaufswagen geklaut
description.content: Ritterhude (lr). Die Serie von Gelegenheitsdiebstählen im Umfeld von Supermärkten reißt nicht ab. Am Montagmittag war ein Rentnerehepaar in einem Verbrauchermarkt in der Riesstraße betroffen. Während des Einkaufs hatten die beiden ihre Geldbörsen in einer Handtasche im Einkaufswagen deponiert. Im Bereich der Backzutaten näherte sich den beiden eine 45 bis 50 Jahre alte und etwa 1,65 Meter große Frau mit dunklen Haaren. Größerer Bedeutung bemaßen sie dem Verhalten jedoch zunächst nicht bei. Das änderte sich, als sie an der Kasse bezahlen wollten. Da fehlten nämlich beide Portemonnaies mit 150 Euro Bargeld und diversen Ausweispapieren.

description.hltext_display: SmarTrend Watching for Potential Pullback in Shares of Lam Research After 0.90% Gain (LRCX)
description.content:
Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $52.04 to a high of $52.81. Yesterday, the shares gained 0.90%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $52.42 on volume of 1.2 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Lam Research are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $46.40 and above their 200-day MA of $40.95. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Lam Research in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on October 25, 2010 at $44.60. The stock has risen 16.8% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $52.42 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Semiconductor Equipment & Materials industry.
Keywords: lam research trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: 특허청 '특허 싱가포르 조약' 가입키로
description.content: 광고 디자인분야 '헤이그 협정'에도 참여 (대전=연합뉴스) 윤석이 기자 = 특허청(청장 이수원)은 상표, 디자인 제도의 국제적 통일성을 꾀하기 위해 2012년 '상표법에 관한 싱가포르 조약' 등에 가입키로 했다고 22일 밝혔다. 싱가포르 조약은 상표 출원ㆍ등록 과정에서 민원인의 실수, 착오 등으로 정해진 기한을 지키지 못했을 경우 추가적인 구제를 받을 수 있도록 절차를 갖추는 등 출원인 중심의 상표출원을 위한 국제간 약속이다. 현재는 민원인이 심사관의 의견제출통지서 등에 대한 답변을 기한에 하지 못하면 곧바로 거절결정이 내려진다. 또 싱가포르 조약에 가입하면 상표 출원과 관련한 서류를 국제적으로 규격화해 각국의 서식에 맞지 않더라도 국제서식상의 내용과 일치하면 적법한 서류로 인정받을 수 있다. 조약상 의무사항은 아니지만 소리, 냄새 등 비전형(非典型) 상표도 권리로 인정받을 수 있게 된다. 앞서 내년에는 디자인 분야에서 하나의 서류만으로 여러 나라에 디자인을 출원, 등록할 수 있도록 '디자인의 국제등록에 관한 헤이그 협정'에도 참여키로 했다. 이 협정이 발효되면 해외에서의 보다 빠른 디자인권 확보는 물론 하나의 언어(영어)로 다른 언어권의 나라에도 출원이 가능해진다. 특허청 김창룡 차장은 "이들 국제 조약 가입으로 상표와 디자인 분야에서 출원인의 권리가 크게 강화되는 동시에 보다 간편하게 특허 서비스를 받을 수 있다"며 "철저한 사전 조사와 준비를 거쳐 조약에 가입할 계획"이라고 말했다. 현재 싱가포르 조약에는 미국, 프랑스, 호주 등 22개 나라가, 헤이그 협정에는 유럽 국가를 중심으로 39개 나라가 가입했다. seokyee@yna.co.kr 모바일 애플리케이션

description.hltext_display: notebooksbilliger.de mit eigener Marke
description.content:
Bild vergrößern 720 430 http://img2.magnus.de/image-r720x430-C-e47f8a80-39047421.jpg © notebooksbilliger.de
PC-Systeme aus Deutschland
Die notebooksbilliger.de AG bietet ab sofort PCs unter dem Namen NBB an. Die PCs werden in Deutschland zusammengebaut und bieten 24 Monate Garantie.
Die angebotenen Systeme sind in die Kategorien "Arbeiter", "Alleskönner" und "Spieler" eingeteilt. Alle PCs sind mit DDR3-Speicher, Festplatten von Western Digital, leiseren CPU-Kühlern und Netzteilen (BeQuiet!) ausgestattet. Die von Cooltek gefertigten Gehäuse sind schwarz-orange. Die Systeme sind auf Energiesparsamkeit ausgelegt und entsprechen der neuen EUP-Richtlinie (Verbrauch im Standby max. 1 Watt). Die PCs werden mit Windows 7 oder ohne Betriebssystem angeboten.
Die auf den alltäglichen Bürobetrieb ausgerichteten "Arbeiter"-Systeme setzen insbesondere auf Rechenkraft, Energieeffizienz und eine sehr geringe System-Lautstärke. Die Multimedia-PC-Systeme der Kategorie "Alleskönner" gibt es in sechs Varianten, die alle mindestens 4 GByte Speicher und eine Grafikkarte bieten. Die auf Gaming- und Multimediaperformance ausgelegten "Spieler"-Rechner der mittleren und gehobenen Preisklasse bieten Multicore-Prozessoren von Intel und AMD ab 3 GHz auf Motherboards von Asus mit mindestens 4 GByte Speicher, USB 3.0, Lüftersteuerung und All-in-one-Kartenlesern. Die dedizierten Grafikkarten von ATI und nVidia verfügen über mindestens 1 GByte Speicher mit HDMI-Anschluss. 7.1-Soundkarten sind ebenfalls Standard.
Die Preise reichen von 270 bis zu 2380 Euro. Die Systeme können auf notebooksbilliger.de bestellt werden.

description.hltext_display: Afghan official rebukes NATO for civilian deaths
description.content:
An Afghan provincial governor says NATO needs to exert greater caution in its operations following the death of five civilians during a battle with insurgents.
The office of the governor of Helmand province said in a statement Wednesday that the five civilians killed during the clash a day earlier included three women and two children. NATO says it is investigating the deaths, which Afghan officials say occurred during a Taliban raid on an Afghan national police checkpoint.
Afghan officials have repeatedly spoken out about civilian deaths, arguing that the international forces are not being careful enough to avoid such casualties as the war nears its tenth year. Insurgents also try to use the civilian death toll as a way of rallying support for their cause.

구제역 유입될까 '전전긍긍'..2차 피해 우려도
"이젠 정말 턱밑까지 왔는데 어째야 하나..." 확산 일로를 걷고있는 구제역이 22일 경기도 김포시에까지 유입됐다는 소식이 전해지면서 강화군 축산농가에 비상이 걸렸다.
김포와의 거리가 멀지 않아 농가 간의 왕래도 잦은 데다 지난 4월 구제역으로 큰 피해를 입었던 전력까지 있기 때문이다.
현재 강화 지역의 축산농민들은 외부 출입도 삼간 채 방역 작업에 총력을 기울이고 있지만 수도권까지 올라온 '구제역 태풍'의 위력에 불안감을 감추지 못하고 있다.
덕성리 주민 이모(52)씨는 "사야할 물건이 있어도 모두 미뤄두고 돼지.소 농장을 운영하는 주민들끼리는 서로 마실도 안 다닐 정도로 조심하고 있다"면서 "하지만 아무리 주의를 해도 100% 차단은 불가능한 터라 발만 동동 구르고 있는 형편"이라고 마을 분위기를 전했다.
올 봄 구제역 때문에 기르던 돼지와 소 약 1천300마리를 살처분한 나모(58)씨는 "구제역이 발생한 김포 돼지농장 주인과 잘 아는 사이지만 미안해서 전화도 못 하고 있다"면서 "이런 상황에서는 위로도 귀에 잘 안 들어온다. 내가 겪어봐서 알지.."라며 안타까워했다.
나씨는 이어 "그래도 하던 일이 이거라 얼마 전 돼지 55마리를 입식했는데 또 구제역이 터졌다"면서 "내년 봄까지 기다렸어야 하는 건데 후회된다"라며 씁쓸해했다.
불은면에서 한우를 기르는 이모(52)씨도 "설마설마 했는데 결국 구제역이 김포까지 왔다고 하니 큰일이다"라면서 "내일부터 다시 추워진다고 하니 소독약이 얼어버릴까 걱정"이라며 한숨을 내쉬었다.
구제역 발생에 따른 2차 피해를 우려하는 목소리도 높아지고 있다. 구제역이 터지면 강화군을 찾는 관광객의 발길이 줄어 식당이나 숙박업소도 타격을 받는다는 것이다.
선원면에서 식당을 운영하는 김모(48)씨는 "구제역이 터진 축산농가는 정부에서 보상이라도 해주지만, 우리가 입는 피해는 보상받을 길조차 없다"면서 "올 봄 구제역 때도 손님이 뚝 끊겨 손해가 컸는데 또 그런 일이 벌어지면 어떻게 살아야 하느냐"라고 하소연했다.
삼산면에 있는 한 펜션 관계자도 "안 그래도 연평도 사태의 여파로 손님 구경하기가 힘든데 구제역까지 터지는 건 상상하기조차 싫다"면서 "관광업계가 입는 피해에 대해서도 정부가 대책을 마련해줬으면 좋겠다"라고 말했다.
[연합뉴스]

description.hltext_display: 韓国企業来年は設備投資6．1％増やす、商議所調べ
description.content:
聯合 12月22日(水)14時34分配信 【ソウル22日聯合】大韓商工会議所が22日に明らかにしたところによると、韓国企業1012社を対象に行ったアンケート調査の結果、来年の設備投資規模はことしより平均6．1％増えると集計された。増加率は大企業が6．7％、中小企業が5．8％で、企業規模によりやや差がみられた。
ことしより設備投資を増やすとした回答企業は37．2％、ことしと同水準とした企業は57．5％だった。設備投資を減らすと答えた企業は5．3％にとどまった。投資拡大の理由としては、新成長エンジンなど新規事業への進出（37．3％）、輸出・内需の肯定的な見通し（32．0％）、老朽施設の改善（26．1％）などが挙がった。
業種別の設備投資増加率は造船が10．3％で最も高く、次いで通信・放送（9．4％）、鉄鋼・金属（8．5％）、機械（8．0％）、製油・石油化学（7．8％）と続く。建設が唯一、投資を減らすと回答し、マイナス0．2％となった。
ことしの投資実績は、昨年に比べ平均26．6％増加した。大企業が28．1％で、中小企業の25．9％を上回った。ことし投資を増やした理由に最も多く挙げられたのは、景気回復に伴う輸出・内需の回復（31．3％）だった。
北朝鮮による延坪島砲撃など「北朝鮮リスク」が投資計画に影響を与えるかとの質問には、88．2％が「特に影響はない」と答えた。
【関連記事】FTAは韓国企業に投資機会もたらす、ペルー大統領＜G20＞首脳会談計画相次ぐ、韓国企業進出拡大の契機なるか最終更新:12月22日(水)14時34分

description.hltext_display: Marcharán en Juárez contra la impunidad
description.content:
Todos los días, a las once de la mañana, colocarán veladoras en la entrada del Palacio de Gobierno en Chihuahua con el objetivo de recordar la lucha de Marisela Escobedo. Foto: OEM-Informex
Organización Editorial Mexicana
El Sol de México
Ciudad Juárez, Chih. (OEM- Informex).- Víctor Manuel Quintana, activista y promotor de la defensa de los derechos humanos, dio a conocer que este miércoles se llevará a cabo una manifestación en Ciudad Juárez, en memoria de Marisela Escobedo y sobre todo por la impunidad que prevalece en la impartición de justicia en Chihuahua. Destacó que todos los días, a las once de la mañana, colocarán veladoras en la entrada del Palacio de Gobierno en Chihuahua con el objetivo de recordar la lucha de esta mujer ejemplar y también para demostrar que la sociedad sigue indignada y en pie de lucha.
En entrevista radiofónica, precisó que en la entidad se vive con indignación, sobre todo por el asesinato de Marisela Escobedo y de Josefina Reyes.
"No es la primera, por desgracia, Marisela Escobedo, en enero de este mismo año se asesinó a Josefina Reyes, activista de derechos humanos de Juárez, y hay amenazas sobre otras activistas, creo que esto nos habla de que las autoridades no han podido".
En tanto, varias mantas fueron colocadas en Chihuahua capital y en Ciudad Juárez, en las que el cártel de Sinaloa ofrece castigar y hacer justicia a los asesinos de Marisela Escobedo. Este cártel destacó que lo hace por solidaridad con Marisela Escobedo, la activista recientemente ejecutada por exigir justicia contra el asesino de su hija y cuyos familiares han sido amenazados.
En Chihuahua, la narcomanta se ubicó en el puente peatonal de la Avenida Tecnológico, frente a la Ciudad Deportiva, mientras que en Ciudad Juárez, la segunda manta fue colocada en las cercanías de la clínica del IMSS, en donde Marisela Escobedo trabajaba como enfermera.
En las mantas, los narcotraficantes piden a la ciudadanía denunciar a los integrantes del cártel de "La Linea" y a "Los Zetas", para limpiar la plaza.

description.hltext_display: TransCanada r�pond aux opposants de son projet de pipeline Keystone XL
description.author: La Presse Canadienne
description.content: CALGARY - Le président et chef de la direction de TransCanada, Russ Girling, a déclaré mardi, au sujet de l'opposition à l'expansion prévue d'un pipeline entre l'Alberta et le Texas, que les sables bitumineux continueraient d'être exploités indépendamment du sort réservé au projet.

description.hltext_display: Initiative "OHZ bewegt sich" lädt zum Tanz in das neue Jahr
description.content:
Aktion am Silvesterabend ab 23.30 Uhr auf dem Scharmbecker Marktplatz / Walzerklänge und alkoholfreier Punsch
- 22.12.2010 - 0 Kommentare Osterholz-Scharmbeck. Der Walzer um Mitternacht vorm Theater am Goetheplatz ist in Bremen eine liebgewonnene Silvester-Tradition. "Das können wird auch", haben sich einige Aktive der Initiative "OHZ bewegt sich" gesagt. Sie laden nun für Freitag, 31. Dezember, ab 23.30 Uhr auf den Scharmbecker Marktplatz ein. Jung und Alt, Paare und Alleinstehende können dort auf 2011 anstoßen und ins neue Jahr hineintanzen. "Wir hoffen darauf, dass viele mit uns feiern wollen und dass das eine regelmäßige Veranstaltung wird", sagt Marlies Blume von der Seniorenbegegnungsstätte.
Die Einrichtung steht ebenso hinter der Kampagne "OHZ bewegt sich" wie der Roland-Mühlentreff, der Seniorenbeirat der Stadt und das Familienzentrum und Mehrgenerationenhaus. Blume erklärt: "Wenn OHZ sich bewegen soll und wir vor allem auch die Innenstadt damit beleben wollen, dann muss der Marktplatz als Mittelpunkt dazugehören: dort, wo das Leben ist." Und der Unternehmer Ditmar Kurz ergänzt: "Der Wirtschaftstreff steht auch dahinter." Ziel müsse es sein, auch die Kaufleute aktiv zu beteiligen. Die Walzerklänge zum Jahreswechsel seien ein Baustein, dem weitere folgen sollen.
Betont unaufwändig sei das nächtliche Tanz-Treffen gedacht, einfach aber verbindend: "Es soll uns und die Gäste wenig bis gar nichts kosten", sagt Jutta Menke vom Seniorenbeirat. "Es ist ja kein großes Drumherum nötig, um Spaß zu haben." Die große Eiche wird noch den Weihnachtsschmuck tragen, dazu kümmern sich die Organisatoren um Stehtische, Kerzen, Lichter und Grünschmuck, um Ordner, Heizstrahler und alkoholfreien Punsch sowie um die Musikkonserven - bevorzugt im Dreivierteltakt, versteht sich. Dass Stagges Hotel geöffnet haben und die Stadthalle geschlossen sein wird, könnte den Machern in die Karten spielen. Um ein Feuerwerk müssen sie sich aus naheliegenden Gründen auch nicht groß kümmern. Wer eigene Gläser und Getränke mitbringen will, sei ebenfalls willkommen, sagen sie.
"Ich bin ganz sicher, es wird voll", sagt Ditmar Kurz. "Alles Große hat mal klein angefangen." Wer noch Fragen hat oder Ideen beisteuern möchte, kann sich an Anne Deutsch vom Familienzentrum wenden: Telefon 04791/5411.

description.hltext_display: EMIRA OFFICE PORTFOLIO SHOWS INCREASE IN VACANCIES - Thabang Mokopanele
description.content:
EMIRA PROPERTY FUND CEO JAMES TEMPLETON yesterday said the group's vacancies had risen in the past few months due to tougher than expected economic conditions. The weakness had been mainly in the office portfolio, specifically in Cape Town and Johannesburg. In the five months to Dec., EMIRA saw an increase of only 0.5% on renewals, but on new leases the increase was flat with no growth. Thus tough conditions, hikes in rates and a competitive market have resulted in growth in income slowing from 3.3% in the year to end-Jun. to 0.4% in the five months year to date of EMIRA's current financial year. But TEMPLETON said the fund was optimistic next year would be a better year for the property sector due to improving retail sales.
INNOVATIVE DEMAND IN BID FOR KWV - Tim Cohen
22 December 2010 - Business Day
PIONEER FOODS' bid for KWV has just become more dense, with fund manager OPPORTUNE resorting to the unusual tactic of submitting a Promotion of Access to Information Act application as part of its effort to draw out a higher bid. The use of the PAIA application, while not unknown in proxy battles, is something of an innovation. PIONEER has formally submitted an offer of R12/share for KWV, and the latter is in the process of evaluating that bid. By some calculations the bid price implies a P:E ratio for KWV of about 40, compared with DISTELL's ratio of 15. CHRIS LOGAN, portfolio manager of OPPORTUNE, argues that while this return on equity might be low, they are historic numbers and the company has set itself the target of much higher returns. If this argument is credible, the R12/share bid must be too low. Hence LOGAN is using PAIA to gain documents to assess the basis on which KWV concluded it could increase its return on equity. The application says that on Oct. 27, KWV shareholders were told at the AGM that the company had a five-yaer strategic goal to achiever ROE of 15%. "The achievement of anything like this stated strategic goal will result in KWV trading at a substantial premium of net asset value," the document argues. "Since the PIONEER approach, KWV shareholders have only received reports from directors arguing why the PIONEER offer is fair." Thus OPPORTUNE is requesting records providing detail on how KWV intends delivering on its strategic goal of achieving 15% ROE by 2014.
PLATMIN COMPLETES US$90M PLACEMENT
22 December 2010 - Business Report
PLATMIN yesterday said it had completed its previously announced placing of 98.9m new shares at US$0.91/common share for total gross proceeds of US$90m. A total of 83.8m shares were indirectly placed with Dutch pension manager ALGEMENE PENSIOEN GROEP N.V. Following the placing, APG will indirectly hold 124.998m shares, representing around 16.7% of the then outstanding common shares. PLATMIN said the proceeds of the placing would be used for general corporate purposes and for future growth opportunities.
RICH MKHONDO TO BE MTNs TOP PR - Sapa
22 December 2010 - Business Report
Former journalist and World Cup spokesman RICH MKHONDO has been appointed head of MTN's corporate affairs division, the company said yesterday. MKHONDO replaces NOZIPHO JANUARY-BARDILL, who has left the company. MKHONDO will be group spokesman and responsible for implementing its stakeholder relations strategies in Africa and the Middle East.
NORTHAMs PROFITS TO FALL
22 December 2010 - Business Report
NORTHAM PLATINUM yesterday advised that its EPS and HEPS for the six months to end-Dec. were estimated to be between 15c and 25c, compared with the 59.9cps recorded y/y. NORTHAM said the decline followed lower sales revenues due to the strike and production interruptions at the beginning of the financial year due to safety related stoppages. Interim results will be released on Feb. 25.
MERCANTILE REVIEWED FOR POSSIBLE DOWNGRADE
22 December 2010 - Business Report
MOODY's has placed MERCANTILE BANK LIMITED on review for possible downgrade. The action followed MOODY's decision to place CAIXA GERAL DE DEPOSITAOS' standalone bank financial strength rating of D+ on review for possible downgrade. CGD is the parent of MERCANTILE BANk with a 92% stake. Under MOODY's methodology, a parent bank's standalone rating serves as a key input in assessing its capacity to support its banking subsidiaries which, in turn, can provide uplift to the deposit and debt ratings of a bank, the ratings agency said. MOODY's previous rating action of A2.za/P-1.za for MERCANTILE was implemented on Feb. 22, 2008, when ratings were first assigned.
TURNAROUND FOR RACEC
22 December 2010 - Fin24.com
RACEC GROUP posted a turnaround in the year to end-Sep. with diluted HEPS of 9.4c after a loss of 12cps y/y. Revenue grew to R394.2m from R344.6m a year ago, while gross profit rose to R84m from R60.3m. Profit for the period rose to R12.9m after a loss of R13.2m y/y. RACEC Electrification was completing two large projects in the Western Cape and RACEC Rail successfully tendered on projects in Sierra Leone and Mozambique. The group reported a 14% increase in revenue, but its performance was dampened by continued pressure on revenue and margins due to tough trading conditions.
PIONEER PENALISES PRICE-FIXING MANAGERS
22 December 2010 - Fin24.com
PIONEER FOOD GROUP yesterday said that "appropriate action" had been taken by the board to discipline the managers responsible for anticompetitive behaviour. Disciplinary action had been taken against 41 employees, one of whom was found not guilty by an external independent presiding officer. Thirty-eight admitted to guild and received written warnings, while action against two other employees is still in progress. Additionally, executive management did not receive any incentive bonuses for the year, executive directors did not receive any increases for 2011 and the majority of the executive management team were not allocated new share appreciation rights for 2011.
UNIONS SEEK WALMART GUARANTEES
22 December 2010 - Fin24.com
COSATU yesterday said it would meet with MASSMART and WALMART early in 2011 to seek "a few guarantees". WALMART is in the process of acquiring a majority stake in MASSMART. COSATU said while it welcomes foreing investment in the country, this should not come at the expense of local jobs. COSATU general secretary ZWELINZIMA VAVI said it was "clear from the history of WALMART that it has a potential of completely undermining the South African manufacturing capacity". VAVI warned that local retailers were under threat from the WALMART-MASSMART union - there were already reports that the two are spending about R67m a day on advertising alone.
FIRM ADMITS TO CHICKEN RECYCLING - Sapa
22 December 2010 - Fin24.com
SUPREME POULTRY yesterday admitted it does "rework" chickens for human consumption, but said it has never supplies such chickens to supermarket chains. The COUNTRY BIRD subsidiary wouldn't say where the reworked birds were sold. SUPREME POULTRY also said it was taking legal action against former employee JOHAN MATTHEE, the source of the story published in Rapport at the weekend. According to the report, the company was allegedly thawing, washing, injecting, rebranding, then reselling the chickens with new expiry dates to outlets such as PICK N PAY HOLDINGS and SHOPRITE CHECKERS. SUPREME said re-working happened on a limited scale and was always conducted in accordance with the protocols as dictated by the department of agriculture. The company said claims of illegal reworking had been the "malicious" work of MATTHEE, whose services had recently been terminated on the grounds of alleged sexual harassment.
HYPROP SECURES R9BN ACQUISITION
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
HYPROP INVESTMENTS today announced it has concluded formal agreements regulating the terms of its offer to acquire the whole of ATTFUND RETAIL for R8.986bn. The transaction is less the value of ATTFUND's debt as at the effective date of the offer. The deal will increase HYPROP's portfolio to 22 properties with a gross value of about R20bn, almost doubling its size while enabling it to retain its retail focus. HYPROP plans to issue 112m of its combined units at R54, totalling R6.048bn, while the balance will be in cash. On implementation of the offer, ATTFUND RETAIL shareholders will pay a R130m transaction fee to REDEFINE PROPERTIES. The fee will be settled out of the cash portion of the consideration.
NEPI RIGHTS OFFER FULLY SUBSCRIBED
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
NEW EUROPE PROPERTY INVESTMENTS yesterday said shareholders had applied for a total of 15m new shares the company had issued, resulting in a 100% subscription. Following the issue of the new NEPI shares, the total issued share capital of the company will increase to just under 77m ordinary shares. The new NEPI shares are expected to commence trading on the LSE and the JSE respectively.
CSC WELCOMES ULTIMATUM FOR SIMON
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
CAPITAL SHOPPING CENTRES GROUP yesterday welcomed the announcement by the Takeover Panel, setting a deadline for SIMON PROPERTY GROUP to either provide a firm offer for CAPITAL of withdraw. The deadline was set for Jan. 12. SIMON, which owns 5% of CSC's shares, made the buyout proposal to CSC's board last week and offered 425pps in cash. CSC rejected the offer, saying it believed this was yet another attempt by SIMON to frustrate the TRAFFORD CENTRE acquisition without putting forward a proper proposal for CSC shareholders to consider as an alternative.
DE BEERS UNAWARE OF ANGLO BUYOUT PLOT
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
DE BEERS yesterday said it had no knowledge of weekend reports from London that ANGLO AMERICAN was plotting a takeover. ANGLO said it would not comment on speculation. DE BEERS spokesman TOM TWEEDY also called the report "speculation" as the company had no knowledge of a takeover plan. ANGLO AMERICAN owns 45% of DE BEERS, with the OPPENHEIMER family holding 40% and the government of Botswana 15%. Should ANGLO opt to buy out the OPPENHEIMERs, it could pay at least £2bn.
RARE HOLDINGS IN SHARE ISSUE
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
RARE HOLDINGS yesterday said it planned to raise R40m through the issue of 100m ordinary shares with a par value of one cent each at an issue price of 40cps to STAFRIC INVESTMENTS AND MANAGEMENT SERVICES. RARE said it was in need of further working capital which has exerted pressure on its day to day business activities. It has decided to raise equity capital due to the lack of immediate long-term debt funding alternatives. RARE will also enter into a loan agreement with MAYFAIR SPECULATORS as interim relief until the issue has been implemented. STAFRIC will, after the subscription, control 35% or more of the votes attaching to the issued shares of RARE. The subscription will thus trigger a mandatory offer to shareholders to be made by STAFRIC. The mandatory offer would therefore be extended to shareholders at the offer price of 40cps. RARE shareholders holding 75.18% of the shares in issue have undertaken to vote in favour of the shareholders' resolutions. In terms of the MAYFAIR loan, the capital sum of R40m will be advanced in two tranches of R20m each payable no later than end-Dec. 2010 and end-Jan. 2011 respectively. The loan will be repaid on the earlier of Mar. 31 2011 or when the company receives payment from STAFRIC under the subscription.
SASOL WILL START FEASIBILITY EARLY 2011 ON CANADA GTL PLANT - Liezel Hill
21 December 2010 - Mining Weekly
SASOL expects to start work early next year on a gas to liquid fuel plant in Western Canada, senior group executive LEAN STRAUSS said yesterday. SASOL yesterday said it would pay C$1.05bn for a 50% stake in shale assets owned by TALISMAN ENERGY. TALISMAN will keep the other 50% of its Farrell Creek assets, and will continue as the operator. The companies have agreed to study the potential for a GTL facility using SASOL's technology. SASOL expects to build a two-train facility in Canada, STRAUSS said, although he cautioned that it was "early days" to speculate on the specifics of the future plant. The transaction announced yesterday includes 51 000 acres of land, representing an estimated contingent resource of 9.6 trillion cubic feet. SASOL will pay 25% of the purchase price in cash at closing and will carry 75% of TALISMAN's future capital commitments in the Farrell Creek area, to a total of around C$790m. The deal is expected to close in H1 2011.
STANDARD BANK DISAPPOINTED - Sapa
21 December 2010 - Business Report
The demands Solidarity was making on STANDARD BANK over retrenchments were neither reasonable nor in the interest of employees, the bank said yesterday. STANDARD was responding to the union's charge that it had given employees an "arrogant slap in the face" by not considering proposals to mitigate the effect of layoffs. The bank said of the 1 145 employees in SA facing retrenchment, only 18 were Solidarity members, of which three have been redeployed. Redeployment efforts would continue until Jan. 31 2011, despite the fact that the employees would have received a month's notice. STANDARD said it had given the union's suggestions due consideration, but did not believe the demands were reasonable or in the interest of the bank, its employees and stakeholders. Solidarity earlier yesterday said although it and the bank had agreed on the "substance" of the retrenchments, it was not sattisfied with the severance packages offered.
LIBERUM SEES STRATEGIC MERIT IF ANGLO RAISED DE BEERS STAKE - Liezel Hill
21 December 2010 - Mining Weekly
LIBERUM CAPITAL mining analysts yesterday noted that it would be a positive move for ANGLO AMERICAN if it increased its holding in DE BEERS to 90%. The Sunday Times reported that the ANGLO board could buy the OPPENHEIMER family's 45% holding in DE BEERS for £2bn. The analysts said such a move would have strategic merit, clarifying the DE BEERS' ownership issue once and for all and whether diamonds are 'core' to ANGLO. DE BEERS has yet to announce a new CEO after GARETH PENNY announced in Jul. he would step down from the position. ANGLO CEO CYNTHIA CARROLL in Aug. said there were no plans to spin out or list DE BEERS.
MWEB TO LIGHT UP SAT-3 CAPACITY
21 December 2010 - Business Report
MWEB yesterday said it had landed SAT-3 cable capacity in its Cape Town node. This formed part of MWEB's ongoing bandwidth capacity upgrades and brought a significant degree of resilience to its network. The SAT-3 undersea fibre optic cable runs up the west coast of Africa to Portugal. Although MWEB will be buying the capacity on SAT-3, the service will be managed by SEACOM which allowed MWEB to have one point of contact through a single service provider. MWEB had a strong working relationship with SEACOM.
SIMMERS CEO RESIGNS
21 December 2010 - Business Report
SIMMER & JACK MINES yesterday announced that interim CEO NICO SCHOEMAN had resigned with effect from Dec. 30 in order to pursue other opportunities. The company's current CFO, MARIUS SAAIMAN, had been appointed interim CEO with effect from Jan. 3.

description.hltext_display: Foundry Education Foundation Announces Annual Scholarships
description.content:
Digital Magazine Table of Contents Subscribe
Released on November 30, 2010
The Foundry Education Foundation (FEF) announced on Nov. 19 that its highest award, the E.J. Walsh Award, was presented to former FEF student and President Lifetime Patron Richard Poirier.
The award was announced during the foundations annual reception, which concluded the 2010 FEF College Industry Conference, held Nov. 18-19 at the Westin Michigan Avenue, Chicago. Nearly 250 industry executives, student delegates, key professors and university administrators attended the conference.
The conference gave 90 student delegates the opportunity to interact with representatives of 36 companies in the metalcasting industry. The information session and social time before and after the event is structured to facilitate the sharing of job opportunities and to connect students to potential employers in the industry.
The FEF/AFS Distinguished Professor Award was given to FEF Key Professor, Pradeep Rohatgi, University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, in recognition of his demonstrated personal interest in his students, as well as his knowledge of the industry. As part of the luncheon this year, the Student Delegate scholarships were presented (see below for complete list) 21 students were awarded a total of $39,500. Additionally, the Keith Millis and Ron Ruddle scholarship recipients were announced.
CIC Student Delegate Scholarships
Special Scholarships

description.hltext_display: [종합2보]법원 "방응모 전 조선일보 사장, 친일파 맞다"
description.content: 광고 【서울=뉴시스】송윤세 기자 = 방우영 전 조선일보 명예회장이 "방응모 전 사장의 친일행위 결정을 취소해 달라"며 낸 소송에서 사실상 패소했다. 서울행정법원 행정11부(부장판사 서태환)는 22일 방 명예회장이 "친일 인명사전에 방응모 전 사장의 이름을 등재하지 말라"며 낸 친일반민족행위결정처분취소 청구소송에서 일부 승소 판결했다. 재판부는 "방응모 전 사장이 자신이 운영하던 잡지 '조광'에 일제의 침략전쟁에 적극적으로 동조하고 내선일체를 강조하는 문예물 등을 게재한 것은 일본제국주의의 식민통치 및 침략전쟁에 적극 협력한 것으로 볼 수 있다"고 밝혔다. 이어 "1938년부터 1944년까지 지속적으로 국민정신총동원조선연맹, 국민총력조선연맹에서 발기인, 평의원 및 참사로 활동한 것으로 보아 일본의 강압에 의해 각 연맹에 이름만 등재한 것이 아니라 적극적으로 협력해 활동한 것으로 보인다"고 설명했다. 다만 "1944년 9월 조선항공업 창립발기인, 같은해 10월 같은회사 주주와 감사역으로 활동한 부분에 대해서는 단순히 군수품 제조업체에 일부 출자하거나 일정 지위에 있었다는 것만 인정된다"며 "이 부분에 대해 친일행위로 판단한 부분에 대해서만 결정을 취소한다"고 덧붙였다. 방응모 전 사장은 1933년 조선일보 사장으로 취임해 국민총력조선연맹 참사, 조선임전보국단 이사 등으로 활동하며 친일활동을 벌였다. 그는 1937년 경성방송국 시국강연에서 "일본제국은 극동 평화를 확립시키려 한다"는 내용의 강연을 하고, 1938년 조선총독부의 언론통제정책에 협조하기 위해 조직된 조선춘추회의 발기인 겸 간사로 활동하기도 했다. 광복 후에 그는 조선일보를 복간해 사장으로 있다가 6.25전쟁 중인 1950년 납북된 뒤 생사가 확인되지 않았다. 친일반민족행위진상규명위원회(반민규명위)가 지난해 11월 방응모 전 사장 등을 포함한 친일명단 704명을 발표하자, 방우영 명예회장은 "방응모 전 사장에 대한 친일반민족행위결정처분을 취소해 달라"며 지난 1월 소송을 제기했다. knaty@newsis.com[뉴시스 이시간 핫 뉴스]

춘천.원주 의심 신고..동시다발 발생
강원도 평창과 화천 한우농가의 구제역 의심 신고가 22일 양성으로 판정돼 방역에 비상이 걸리면서 '구제역 청정지대'가 위기를 맞았다. 정부 방침보다 강화한 구제역 방역대책을 추진했던 도는 춘천과 원주에서도 의심 신고가 접수되는 등 동시다발적으로 확산하자 망연자실하고 있다.
강원도는 지난 21일 평창군 대화면 신2리와 화천군 사내면 명월리 한우농가에서 발생한 구제역 유사증세가 결국 양성으로 판정나자 이날 반경 500ｍ 이내의 소 등 우제류 67마리를 신속히 살처분 했다.
또 의심 신고된 춘천 농가는 예방적 차원에서 3개 농가 90만리도 긴급 살처분 했다.
도는 특히 구제역 발생농가를 비롯해 의심 신고 농가를 중심으로 500ｍ 내에서 구제역을 차단한다는 목표로 총력 방역체제에 돌입했다.
이에 따라 전날 의심 신고 당시부터 시행한 해당 농장 출입구 폐쇄, 소독조 설치, 발생 농가로부터 반경 500m 이내 가축 이동 제한 조치 등을 강화했으며 용평면 장평리의 도축장을 폐쇄했다.
해당 농가를 중심으로 위험지역(500m~3㎞)과 경계지역(3~10㎞), 관리지역(10~20㎞) 진출입로 양쪽에 방역대를 설치해 소독을 강화했으며 현재 운영 중인 이동통제초소를 도내 전역으로 확대해 66곳으로 늘리는 등 지역 간 차단방역에 나섰다.
이동통제초소의 원활한 운영과 살처분 등 방역에 따른 인력부족을 대비해 경찰과 군부대에 지원을 요청하기로 했다.
이와 함께 최초 의심 신고 접수 후 확인에 들어간 수의사와 농장주 및 가족 등의 외부 출입을 전면 금지하고 경계지역 내의 우제류에 대한 임상관찰을 강화하고 있다.
도는 감염경로를 조사한 결과 평창은 지난 13일 공수의사가 다녀갔을 뿐 특이사항이 발견되지 않아 일단 공수의사가 방문한 대화면과 평창읍의 39개 농가에 대해 이동통제 조치하는 한편 임상관찰을 벌이고 있다.
화천도 별다른 특이사항이 없어 방역 당국이 역학조사에 애를 먹고 있으나 감염경로를 추적하는 데 온 힘을 기울이고 있다.
이밖에 도는 추가 발생을 막으려고 이동통제소 방역 인원을 1일 평균 751명에서 2천여명으로 대폭 늘리고 도와 시.군 등 24개 비상대책 상황실 근무 인력도 70여명에서 280여명으로 확대했으며 예찰인원과 역학조사원, 방역사 등도 늘릴 예정이다.
도는 오는 23일 오전 구제역 비상방역대책회의과 민.관.군 협의회를 잇따라 열고 방역대책반별 조치 계획과 관계기관별 협조사항 등을 논의해 강력히 추진한다는 방침이다.
또 정부가 구제역 대책의 '마지막 수단'인 예방백신을 접종키로 방침을 정함에 따라 정부의 지침을 받는 대로 시행한다는 방침이다.
박창수 농정산림국장은 "구제역이 한 번도 발생하지 않았던 청정지역이어서 정부 방침보다 강화한 방역 대책을 추진했는데 구제역이 발생해 안타깝다"며 "동원할 수 있는 모든 방역대책을 가동해 피해를 최소화하겠다"라고 말했다.
한편, 도내에서는 1만6천여 농가에서 23만여마리의 한우, 500여 농가에서 43만여마리의 돼지를 사육해 한우는 전국의 8.2%, 돼지는 4.3%의 점유율을 보이고 있으며 사슴과 젖소 등 총 우제류 사육은 1만7천33농가에서 72만여마리이다.
[연합뉴스]

description.hltext_display: Desmiente Gobernación secuestro de 50 migrantes
description.content:
El tren de carga no fue interceptado ni detuvo su camino hasta el punto en que se efectuó el operativo, en el que fueron asegurados 92 indocumentados, en Oaxaca. Foto: OEM-Informex
Organización Editorial Mexicana
Manrique Gandaria / El Sol de México
Ciudad de México.- La Secretaría de Gobernación sostuvo que son falsas las afirmaciones de la Cancillería salvadoreña, la cual denunció el secuestro de poco más de 50 centroamericanos el pasado 16 de diciembre en la localidad de Chahuites, Oaxaca, por parte de un grupo armado.
A través de un comunicado, la Segob refirió que hasta el momento el Instituto Nacional de Migración (INM) no cuenta con evidencia alguna de que un tren haya sido obstaculizado o bloqueado por algún grupo en la localidad de Chahuites, antes de un operativo efectuado el pasado viernes por agentes migratorios.
Ello luego de que la víspera la representación diplomática emitió un comunicado en el que, de acuerdo con entrevistas realizadas por personal consular, migrantes de diversas nacionalidades señalaron a un supuesto grupo de hombres armados que habría obstruido con piedras y troncos la línea férrea, obligando a detener el tren para golpearlos, robar sus pertenencias y secuestrar a un número indeterminado de personas.
Al respecto, el INM reiteró que el tren de carga no fue interceptado ni detuvo su camino hasta el punto en que se efectuó el operativo, del cual se informó el pasado viernes y en el que se aseguró a 92 indocumentados en la zona del Istmo en el estado de Oaxaca.
La Secretaría de Gobernación insistió en que, en cumplimiento de la Ley General de Población (LGP) y con el propósito de evitar que los migrantes sean víctimas de la delincuencia organizada, continuará realizando sus operativos para poner a salvo sus vidas y repatriarlos a su país de manera segura y ordenada, respetando siempre su dignidad y sus derechos humanos.
En tanto, el INM afirmó que, en congruencia con lo anterior, el pasado 31 de agosto las secretarías de Gobernación y Seguridad Pública y la Comisión Nacional de Derechos Humanos (CNDH) firmaron el Acuerdo sobre la Estrategia Integral para la Prevención y Combate al Secuestro de Migrantes.
Posteriormente se suscribió con los gobiernos de los estados de Tabasco, Campeche y Chiapas un convenio de colaboración que establece la Estrategia Integral para la Prevención y Combate al Secuestro de Migrantes en la Frontera Sur, con el propósito de reforzar la seguridad de quienes se internan de forma indocumentada en territorio mexicano.
Asimismo, el pasado mes de octubre, por iniciativa del secretario de Gobernación, José Francisco Blake Mora, se llevó a cabo la Reunión ministerial sobre delincuencia organizada, transnacional y seguridad de los migrantes, en la que se establecieron compromisos regionales para prevenir y garantizar la seguridad de los migrantes.
"En lo que respecta al caso del tren en Oaxaca, al consultar con autoridades locales y federales, así como a la compañía ferroviaria, no se encontraron antecedentes que confirmen las versiones señaladas por la representación salvadoreña y tampoco existen denuncias ante autoridades mexicanas presentadas por parte de migrantes extranjeros al día de hoy", dijo.

description.hltext_display: Probe paper on bus crash ready in two weeks
description.content:
Kuala Lumpur: The investigation paper on the double-decker express bus crash at Km 15 of the Cameron Highlands-Simpang Pulai Road which killed 27 people, including 25 Thai tourists, is expected to be ready in two weeks.
Managing Director of the Malaysian Institute of Road Safety Research (Miros), Prof. Dr Ahmad Farhan Mohd Sadullah, said a detailed analysis of the crash was being done with the cooperation of other agencies like the police and Public Works Department.
"The probe is still in the early stage and the outcome is only expected in about two weeks' time as usually the case," he said when contacted Tuesday.
He, however, said according to the standards, double-decker buses were not suitable for negotiating roads on hilly terrain.
"On a sloping road, the double-decker which is higher than normal buses, is not in a very stable condition and may pose a danger to the passengers.
This type of bus is more suitable for flat roads."
Ahmad Farhan said bus operators should therefore take the suitability and conditions of buses into consideration before ferrying passengers to their destinations.
Bukit Aman Traffic Chief Datuk Abdul Aziz Yusof said all aspects, including the condition of the bus and road were being covered in the police investigation into yesterday's horrific accident.
"At this moment, we should not be pointing fingers at anyone until the results of the investigation are known," he said.
The Pan Malaysia Bus Operators Association has urged the government to hold short-term courses for bus drivers to improve their driving skills, and also on providing emergency first-aid and in fire-prevention.
Its President, Datuk Mohamad Ashfar Ali, said the Government must also look at how driving schools were teaching those applying for the bus driving licence, to ensure they would become efficient drivers, hence reducing road accidents and fatalities.
In light of Monday's tragic express bus crash, he also urged the Road Transport Department to place warning signs at the "black spots" or accident-prone road stretches.
Road Transport Workers Union Secretary-General Datuk Zainal Rampak said the Government should carry out the proposed construction of a short-cut road to Simpang Pulai which would reduce travelling time and avoid travelling on a sloping road because of the hilly terrain.
Meanwhile, the Land Public Transport Commission (LPTC) is making road safety a high priority area in its list of concerns as it moves towards full operation next year.- Bernama

description.hltext_display: ソン・ガンホとイ・ナヨンが初共演…強力係刑事に変身
description.content:
とイ・ナヨンが初共演…強力係刑事に変身 12月22日(水)15時14分配信 ユ・ハ監督の新作「ハウリング」（仮題）で初共演する俳優（左）と女優イ・ナヨン（右）。 俳優と女優イ・ナヨンが、ユ・ハ監督の新作「ハウリング」（仮題）で初めて共演する。
同作は自然発火連鎖殺人事件を追跡していた強力係刑事らが、事件の背後にオオカミと犬の交配種「狼犬」が絡んでいる事実を知ることで展開していくアクション劇。 は強力係ベテラン刑事サンギルを演じる。 イ・ナヨンは元オートバイ機動隊で特別捜査本部に配属された強力係女刑事ウニョンに扮し、強度の高いアクション演技を繰り広げる予定だ。
「ハウリング」の制作会社オポスピクチャーズの関係者は「今回の作品は、都会を背景で追撃や疾走など、胸のすくようなアクションが展開する映画だ。 『卑劣な通り』『双花店』などで興行と批評の双方から認められているユ・ハ監督が格別のこだわりをもっている作品」として「‘狼犬’という慣れない存在との共感を感性的かつ重厚な密度で描き出している」と説明した。
「ハウリング」は来年上半期にクランクインする予定だ。
【関連記事】俳優、「壊れても映画が面白くなれば不満なし」イ・ナヨン、「逃亡者プランＢ」撮影現場写真を公開最終更新:12月22日(水)15時14分

description.hltext_display: itoiletstand for iPads, Tablets and Other Electronic Devices Coming in 2011
Christchurch International Airport - Australasia?s Largest Video Wall Completes Airport?s Sensory Arrivals Experience
description.content:
Passengers arriving on international flights will, as of this week, be treated to an explosion of sensory experiences as they travel through the terminal from their air bridge to collect their luggage. Christchurch International Airport Ltd has undertaken a major design overhaul in the international airside environment in order to ensure travellers’ first experience of the South Island is particularly memorable, and that it encapsulates the South Island’s main point of difference, the astounding outdoors landscape.
The long air bridge corridors have been completely revamped to provide individual South Island immersive experiences within these contained spaces. The walls have been covered floor to ceiling in special commissioned photography, says Chief Executive Jim Boult. “We wanted to virtually drop passengers into the centre of some of the South Island’s most beautiful landscapes”, he says.
A sensory experience of each landscape completes the passenger journey, with a soundtrack playing sounds from the environment, as well as smells evocative of each region.
In the immigration queuing area, the largest video wall in Australasia entertains passengers with beautifully shot footage of the South Island’s natural environment. 54 seamlessly linked screens play looping clips to create a hypnotic and calming effect.
Illustrative wall graphics based on the magnificent braided rivers of Canterbury guide passengers through the airport, creating a sense of flow between the various areas of the airport.
At the base of the arrivals ramp, a flow of pure artesian water offers a place for passengers to regroup and refresh before entering Duty Free and customs. For many overseas visitors, this will be a truly unique element, delivering on the Tourism New Zealand brand promise, 100% Pure.
Photographic imagery once again takes centre stage at the baggage claim area, with seasonal images of agricultural landscapes supporting our vital border protection agencies.
“By utilising design in a fully immersive manner, Christchurch Airport’s new international arrivals experience touches all the senses, and is set to welcome visitors to an awe-inspiring, world-class airport environment that truly reflects the landscape outside,” says Mr Boult.
Concept and Design: Strategy Design & Advertising, Christchurch.
Christchurch International Airport – New Zealand’s Tourism Gateway
Christchurch International Airport welcomed 6 million passengers in 2009/2010, ranking as New Zealand’s second largest airport. The Airport occupies a unique position economically, as the South Island’s busiest and most strategic air connection to the world’s trade and tourism markets. In addition, the airport plays an important role as the South Islands major domestic hub servicing all New Zealanders, enabling passengers to connect to a full spectrum of destinations throughout New Zealand. Christchurch International Airport is a major driver of the regional Canterbury economy, generating airport precinct related jobs for nearly 5000 people.
Christchurch International Airport is owned and operated by Christchurch International Airport Limited (CIAL). CIAL was established as a limited liability company in 1988, and ownership of CIAL is now shared by Christchurch City Holdings Limited with 75% and the New Zealand Government with 25%. The company’s vision is to be recognised as New Zealand’s leading tourist gateway.
Christchurch International Airport is a carbon neutral company and has received carboNZero certification from Landcare Research following a detailed measurement and analysis process. CIAL is the first airport company in the Southern Hemisphere to attain certified carbon neutral status and is the second carbon neutral certified airport company in the world.
Visit http://www.christchurchairport.co.nz for more information.
###
Chelsea Halliwell
Christchurch International Airport Limited

description.hltext_display: 'Spider-Man' Accident Captured On Video
해안 경계근무하는 장병들
description.content: (당진=연합뉴스) 양영석 기자 = 육군이 23일 경기도 포천시 승진훈련장에서 최대 규모의 합동화력 훈련을 실시한다고 밝힌 가운데 21일 새벽 육군 32사단 장고항 초소 장병들이 충남 당진군 해안 경계근무를 하고 있다.2010.12.22 youngs@yna.co.kr 모바일 애플리케이션

description.content: TORONTO - La Bourse de Toronto a clôturé mardi en forte hausse à la suite de l'annonce d'une transaction majeure dans le secteur financier canadien.

description.hltext_display: Unión de Juristas exige investigar a fondo a magistrados reprobados
description.content:
La activista social Marisela Escobedo, asesinada en Chihuahua, cuyo caso sigue generando reacciones de indignación en diversos sectores. Foto: OEM-Informex
Organización Editorial Mexicana
Manuel Carvallo / El Sol de México
Ciudad de México.- "Fue irregular, ilegal y sobre todo inmoral, lo que el Supremo Tribunal de Justicia del Estado de Chihuahua hizo al contratar a los magistrados del Tribunal Oral de Ciudad Juárez, Rafael Boudid, Catalina Ochoa y Nezahualcóyotl Zúñiga, pese a haber reprobado sus exámenes de calidad", aseguró el presidente de la Unión de Juristas de México (UJM), Eduardo Miranda Esquivel.
Tras darse a conocer que los tres magistrados del Tribunal Oral de Ciudad Juárez que liberó al homicida Sergio Barraza, habrían fracasado en su examen para ser jueces del nuevo sistema de justicia en la capital de Chihuahua en el año 2006, pero que pese a ello en Juárez sí fueron contratados por el Supremo Tribunal de Justicia, el presidente de la UJM, exigió:
"Debe investigarse a fondo el proceso de selección y nombramiento de estos magistrados para determinar si se llevó a cabo conforme a la ley, pero sobre todo con honestidad".
Y continuó: "En su caso, de encontrarse irregularidades, deberán fincarle las responsabilidades civiles, administrativas y penales tanto a Rafael Boudid, Catalina Ochoa y Nezahualcóyotl Zúñiga, como a quien indebidamente los contrató".
Exigió también que a todos se les debe juzgar por los delitos de uso indebido del ejerció del cargo y actos contrario a la administración de justicia.
Este caso, consideró, que además de las sanciones administrativas, civiles y penales a las que se hagan acreedores, tanto magistrados como quienes los contrataron, "deben exhibirse para el escarnio y repudio público, ya que su actuación ya costó otra vida inocente más".
"Este caso de corrupción, demuestra una vez más que en México las autoridades están cubiertas de corrupción que trae consigo la tan dañina impunidad en la que mantienen hundido al pueblo", subrayó molesto.

description.hltext_display: Jeanne Phillips: Husband's sex life appears to involve only his TV remote
description.author: Jeanne Phillips
description.content:
Dear Abby: I'm pretty sure my husband is addicted to adult porn movies. We have several pornographic DVDs in the house, and I can tell when they have been moved. He denies he's watching them, so confronting him again will only make him more angry and possibly push him "underground." Our sex life, which used to be grand, has become almost nonexistent. Do you have any suggestions?
Suspicious in Florida
Dear Suspicious: Yes. Rather than accuse your husband of being a porn addict, start a discussion about what has happened to your sex life. He may need to be examined by his doctor to determine if his problem could be physical. If that isn't the case, then marriage counseling with a licensed therapist might help.
However, it doesn't seem likely to me that a man who views only "several" adult DVDs is a porn addict. Porn addicts are usually glued to their computers at every available spare moment.
Dear Abby: I am married for the second time and have two lovely stepsons in their early 20s. Recently they told me that my sister "Gloria" (age 55) had asked them to remove their shirts during a holiday event several years ago. They were teenagers at the time. She told them she wanted to "at least look since she couldn't touch."
For the record, Gloria has a history of poor impulse control. She takes medication for it and also to control her temper.
My relationship with my sister has always been contentious.
Should I stop having family gatherings? Should I ask other relatives to police her? How do I confront her about the many things she has done?
Vexed in Virginia
Dear Vexed: Because your sister seems unable to distinguish between what is and isn't appropriate behavior, have a talk with her and tell her what you expect from her before the next family gathering. I see little to be gained from a "confrontation."
If Gloria manages not to start trouble at the party, continue to include her. If not, no law says you must. If you don't, be prepared for questions about her absence and answer them directly and honestly.
Dear Abby: I am a woman who is wondering what to say when someone calls me "sir" on the phone. I have heard my voice recorded, and I don't think I sound like a man. Still, it happens. It makes me feel angry and mortified. What do I say?
"Ma'am" in Cinnaminson, N.J.
Dear "Ma'am": You should say, "For your information, I'm a woman." That should clear up any confusion.
Dear Abby: I recently had a dinner party in my condo. One of my guests brought along his new roommate. During the evening, the young man kept placing his foot on my coffee table and rubbing the sole of his shoe over the edge and corner.
After the party ended, I realized my coffee table had been damaged by what he did.
What is a polite way to tell someone to remove his or her foot from my table without causing a scene or embarrassing him?
Mitch in Chicago
Dear Mitch: Offer the person a footstool or something to place under the offending foot that would protect your table. Or, take an even more direct approach: "Please don't put your foot there because the finish on my coffee table is easily damaged."
Write Dear Abby at www.DearAbby.com or P.O. Box 69440, Los Angeles, CA 90069.

event_or_fact.property: she wanted to "at least look since she couldn't touch.
